name: The Stephen Hopkins House
reviews: Strolling through the streets we came across this little historical gem. Actually it lured us in (there was a boulenteer out front inviting people in). Once in the home, a very knowledgable tour guide, more of a historian, took us through each room of the home sharing stories and details of the important man who owned this house. The tour was free, surprisingly since it was really well done. The guide took time to answer any questions and let you look around each room. You never felt rushed. The staff are very friendly and helpful.  If you want to learn a little bit of American history and about the important man who lived here, I highly recommend spending some time to visit this charming little home.

I would like to start my review with the tourist guide who actually invited us to visit this place.

So, we were roaming around and guide asked us to take a look into that place and history related to it. Since i was visiting from Canada, i had no clue who Stephen Hopkins was but after the tour, I actually read a lot about him and his life experience. 

This house is a great place to visit if you’re interested to see how people used to live in colonial society. Everything related to Stephen Hopkins is still placed in that house and history is very interesting.
This is a great place to visit. So much history. Our guide was very knowledgeable. There is no cost to tour the place but they do ask for donations. This house is over 300 years old.

Y'know...I've been to my share of museums, and the long and short of it is this:

1) The less crowded, the better 
2) The more hands on, the better 
3) The guide, if afforded the opportunity to have one, makes or breaks the whole thing. 

We got here at 10am (opening) on a scorching hot Saturday, and we were joined by only one other intrepid scholar. Check one in our museum-fun favor. 

Marjorie (the guide) took us right in. She kept apologizing for the heat, but her warmth and her candor was way more overwhelming. She is a gem and we had a delightful time learning about early Providence. Oh, and she let us carry the water pot...bro, we are PAMPERED with our plumbing and innoculations. 

Of note: I'm impressed with both this house and John Brown's house up the street for their willingness to engage with the stain of slavery head on in both exhibits. 

For any nerds like me and my lady out there, this is a fine hour spent in RI. 

Oh, and it's freaking FREE, so leave a good tip and sign the guestbook... otherwise, the grants stop coming in....sigh.
Great docents explaining the history of the house and its occupants including 5 or 6 slaves.

name: The Providence Athenaeum
reviews:
Getting married in a library usually means you can wander among the books, but you actually have to use a completely different space for your ceremony. Here, you actually have your ceremony in the stacks! A book lovers dream!

You can have both your ceremony and reception here and I have seen 2 weddings with around 100 guests fit well. I don't know if you could honestly fit many more guests though comfortably. 

The Athenaeum allows you to take photos almost anywhere in the library and is very responsive and accommodating- it's not like one of those massive "wedding factories". They don't do many weddings, so it's a lot more relaxed.

The reception area/dance area is broken up downstairs by the stairs coming down in the middle of the room, so you can easily divide dinner from dancing. However, neither space is particularly large so you *can* dance and do the hora, but it's narrow.

If you have any guests with mobility issues, there are a lot of stairs both getting into the venue, going down to the reception area, etc. But they do have entrances that are accessible but you'll need to think ahead to make it run smoothly.
Love it here! If I lived here this would be my second home. Creaky, beautiful, atmospheric, odorific! Some greats have spent time here and you can still feel their presence.

Exquisite, visually stunning! Great ambiance and a perfect place to read. And the story about Edgar Allan Poe & Sarah Helen Whitman, need I say more? Tips, visit when the lights are on (after sunset)...

A really cool working library...reminds me a little of the library at Trinity College.

Definitely a great place to stop over and browse while in the area.

FREE library that holds old intellectual books from various authors. 

Very quiet good place to study and wifi is free. However no food or drinks are allowed.

name: Waterplace Park
reviews: In the winter it's a great place for a walk thru parts of Providence, you can go from downtown all the way to Fox Point.  In the summer there's several cultural activities to enjoy along with areas to sit down and enjoy the sun or a picnic...great place for late night romantic walks.

Great place to escape for lunch or a quick walk around the water. You’ll also find seating to relax, read or just hang out. Kept very clean by friendly staff. Astonishing fire shows on the water at night on summer weekends as well as boats to rent.

Absolutely BEAUTIFUL!  One of Rhode Island's famous attractions. We have people come down from all around the world to see the lighting's.  Here you can rent boats and you can have your very own private tour with a romantic dinner OR you can rent one to enjoy with your loved ones🧸🙌🥰. You can also go KAYAKING!

Fantastic renovation of an original waterway in Providence. A vibrant area of shops, restaurants and art in many forms. Water fire is a treasured experience with varied events throughout the season. Worth a stop anytime.
Great chill spot..usually pretty clean and safe. Great architecture! And a good smoke spot...just dont get caught...

name: RISD Museum
address: 20 N Main St, Providence, RI 02903, USA
reviews: Great museum with unique exhibits and a truly fantastic "raid the icebox" series of curated exhibits. We were pleasantly surprised at the high quality of the exhibits and pieces at a college museum (yes, yes, I realize this is RISD). Enjoyed the wide range of art and styles as well as how well the museum was presented. Well worth the visit!

I had a difficult time enjoying the museum. I think, for me, it's because I had a hard time trying to identify the museum's genre/flavor/what-have-you. There's one paint/work right next to something of a different style from hundreds of years prior. 
That being said, I LOVE that they make it free to the public on certain nights throughout the year to allow everyone to enjoy art.

Fantastic museum, I was not expecting it to be so huge. The collection was incredibly diverse, from period rooms, to contemporary art, Egyptian relics, Japanese relics. It really demonstrates the loves people have loved all over the world throughout time.

Fantastic world class museum! My first visit was 3 years ago. I was amazed by the collection. I was naive in thinking that a college museum in a small city wouldn't rank with the likes of Boston's MFA, but it does! Wonderful collection.
A little challenging to navigate, but the artwork was beautiful and well-curated. I appreciated the diversity of works and the contrast between old and new artists. I'll have to come back!

name: Providence Children's Museum
address: 5th lane, 100 South St, Providence, RI 02903, USA
reviews: I took my grandson a few days ago. It is $12.50 per person to get in adult and child which is not bad for a whole day's worth of fun and learning.  The first floor has the water tables, vacuum and tubes with scarves with balls very cool, and many other tactile things to do. Up the ramp there is puzzles and brain teasers as well as dress up and many other adventures.  It is a whole day's worth of fun. Great place to take the kiddos. As my grandson said.  "It was the best day of his whole life" He goes to many places and had lots of fun.

It is a good place but small and does not change. It is worth joining if you plan to go to other reciprocal children and other museums it is with 100%. My kids get board very quick there. But we use it at other places around the country. It is it good for us, but it is challenging with 4 kids.

MUST SEE!! Outstanding kids museum.. geared towards the younger ones, but lots of room to run, play and explore! 
My little ones favorite is for sure the water room! But there are some great informative lessons and history for older kids and some nice info plaques on the way kids play for adults.

Very interactive place for kids of all sizes and abilities. It was convenient to have a place to eat or take a quick break. Having a ramp to access upper level is awesome. When you may feel 'closed in' head to the enclosed play yard to release more energy!!

This is a wonderful place to play, learn and explore. I have had nothing but amazing times with my little ones here. The staff is very personable. They make you feel very welcome there as soon as you step through the doors all the way until the time you leave. If you need anything a little extra during you're time there, they try and help you out if they have the ability to.

name: Prospect Terrace
reviews: Best views of the city here. Also where Roger Williams' ashes are. Cool spot to see the city from a different perspective. Not too far of a walk from the downtown area.
I moved out of state and love to come visit everytime I'm around. Is one of the most beautiful views in Providence.

Beautiful view of area below. the old state house/ state building. With a large 14-ft status of their Roger Williams. 
Area to seats quite. Green grass

This is a great view of Providence no matter what time of year. It is a small park but nice to spend time to view and chat, it is usually quiet there. I go often and always take those visiting as a must go spot.
This is a "small" public park (with maybe 4-5 benches) named after the Roger Williams. The view here of Providence is spectacular.

name: Roger Williams Park Botanical Center
reviews:
A hidden treasure in Rhode Island. The docent tour is a must to truly see and hear the fascinating life stories.
  We were brought to each habitats and visual treasures of color and textures.
  There were so many hidden treasures within the space. These included pottery, unique plant containers, and heights of plants and trees.

Beautiful greenhouses and a wide variety of plants. Plants in outdoor garden were mostly dead because of winter, but the path  appeared to be well-kept and the plants that exist year round looked very pretty

We got married in the Botanical Center and it was perfection! Our guests loved how unique the space was and enjoyed all the natural beauty of the space. The staff was always friendly and responsive and I would highly recommend the venue to anyone especially if you are getting married off season!
Great for the family. It's peaceful and enjoyable. Perfect atmosphere for children to learn more about the environment. If the rose maze were in full bloom it would have been 5 stars

We took a nice walk at the RW Botanical Gardens and enjoyed just taking our time admiring all the beautiful flowers.  Our 5 year old especially enjoyed looking for the mermaid and the fairies.  Outside we checked out the rose maze. That was fun trying to get to the center. Lastly,  kids can see a couple of goats at the base of the gardens.

name: Roger Williams Park Zoo
reviews: Fantastic visit to the zoo in February! We had such a great time despite the chilly temperatures. We had practically the whole zoo to ourselves! Almost all of the animals were out and much more active than they are in the hotter summer months. We watched the giraffes being fed and the elephants bathed all indoors! So cool! The rainforest room was extra toasty and a fantastic space! The giant otter was a thrill to watch and the free roaming monkeys and birds were amazing. The barnyard was a delight for my 1 year old. And bonus the bathrooms were heated! Overall, the zoo was an amazing place to visit in the winter especially if you enjoy half price admission and no crowds!! Highly, highly recommend!!

This place is very fun on a nice day, the animals will be out and active. On a hot day they will want to lay around. Tickets are not expensive at all. The food can be though, so sometimes it's best to eat well before.

We go every year to the pumpkin spectacular-it is a great night out! We love Halloween and get lots of great ideas for carving our own. The themes change yearly and the imagination and creativity of the carvers is amazing. We absolutely love the laughing tree and how it has grown/evolved over the past few seasons.

This is a great zoo. We go all year round and always enjoy our visits, even in the winter many of the animals are out and about and also there are indoor exhibits the provide a reprieve from the cold. The new rainforest exhibit is so nice! It takes about 2 hours to make your way through, some areas are hilly so it may be smart to bring a stroller if you have little ones.

Roger Williams park zoo is one of the best zoos I have ever been to. Every time me and my family visit, we're always greeted by nice workers and friendly faces. The exhibits are always amazing to see and watching the animals is always a treat. I hope to be able to have a chance to talk with the owner of the wonderful zoo someday.

name: Roger Williams National Memorial
address: 282 N Main St, Providence, RI 02903, USA
reviews: I love this park. Walk my dog here several times a week. As many do. It's always clean and when there's litter, I pick it up. The Rangers do a great job. It has very interesting markers that I still re-read. Always a great experience.

Very friendly staff in the visitor center!! Welcoming and excited to share their knowledge about the site, Rodger Williams, and the history of Providence. Also directed me toward other nearby historic sites of interest. Overall a great little stop in Providence for anyone interested in U.S. history!!

The only national park in Rhode Island, this place doesn’t look like much upon first glance. It’s a nice park, well-maintained and picturesque, but it’s very small for a national park and for the most park looks like any other park in the city. 

The cool part about this park is the history behind it. This is pretty much where Providence was founded, and Roger Williams lived very nearby. There’s a historic well, plenty of informational signs, and a wonderful visitor’s center.

If you’re looking for a breath of fresh air or a stroll through a park, this is an alright option with plenty of better alternatives. If you want to learn more about the history of Providence and Rhode Island, there’s a lot to discover here.
Interesting short movie about Roger Williams.  Friendly, professional & informative!
Providence - really nice place for vacation. Here you can see a lot of huge and gorgeous buildings, beautiful parks and other really good things.

name: Swan Point Cemetery
reviews: Beautiful 300 acre cemetery. Walking around you can tell that a lot of care goes into this place daily. The trees are beautiful and there is an area along the water that is peaceful.

More of a park with headstones than cemetery.  A great look back at the grandeur of death in the 19th century. 
Be aware that taking photos of monuments is officially discouraged, so use discretion.

This has to be one of the most beautiful cemeteries in the entire USA. I don't live here, and only visited the cemetery to admire its trees and gardens, and thought about changing my plans for my final resting place!

From the wonderful experience with Linda Xavier in learning the history of the cemetery to the final day of the funeral, my experience with Swan Point was wonderful. Linda was patient and met with the family time and time again to ensure we were happy with our choice in a plot.  She also gave us a lot of information which made it easier to decide on what to do for a service and funeral.  The cemetery itself is beautiful and peaceful.  I highly recommend meeting with her if interested in Swan Point.  The entire staff there is professional, kind and compassionate.
Beautiful cemetery.

name: DePasquale Square
reviews: Nice square. Good restaurants. Open air atmosphere in the center.
Lots of vibrant colors and with Italian flair meeting Spanish Caribbean style.  The outdoor atrium and fountain are excellent.  You won't go hungry either

This place was hopping on a Sunday night!  Lots of people, great live band playing Frank Sinatra songs, folks dancing.  Get a taste of Italy here in the Federal Hill District of Providence RI.  I had the fig and prosciutto pizza.  It was topped with fresh arugula,  and the crust had a very nice chew.  If you are looking for a place to people watch, and get a nice meal, this is the place!

DePasquale Square is a wonderful place to visit. It has Fine restaurants and a market place for a real Italian feel experience. One Local owner Gianfranco really knows how to please people with the Italian menu and the Italian scenery.
Love this part of providence great to visit at all times of the year highly recommend checking it out if your in town. Especially when the weather is good at night the place really comes alive!

name: The John Brown House Museum
reviews: Nice and cheap for an unguided tour! The house is gorgeous and so much fun to walk through!

The Benefit Street tour starts from the John Brown Museum. You have to book advance and it is a good way to find your way around the historic sites of Providence. Geographically, the tour covers a distance from about the middle of Benefit Street down to the northern end of the street; and historically it roams from the earliest settlers right up to the modern day. The history of Brown University, and the mega rich Brown family who set it up, are inevitably a big part of the story. The family patriarch John Brown features prominently and our guide didn’t shy away from Brown’s less than proud history of slave ownership. There’s also a visit to the Providence Athanaeum, site of some Edgar Allan Poe scandal, and a tour of the First Baptist Church of America, which looks exactly as you would hope a New England church to look. The tour does take a very long time and our teenager was getting a bit fed up at the end, but it was interesting and we learned a lot.

This house is incredible! Take the tour, $10 per. If you get Lyle as your tour guide ask about the burning of the Gaspee. It ties in with a piece on the second floor. Amazing story about the founder of the estate. Lyle is an excellent tour guide.

John Brown was an American abolitionist. Brown advocated the use of armed insurrection to overthrow the institution of slavery in the United States. You will learn more about this man and his brothers who had a different pov on things. It is a great place to learn more about a sad but also liberating part in American history. Without history we are nothing.
Great walking tour of Benefit Street with Denise

name: Carousel Village
reviews: This carousel is beautiful and so much fun. I enjoy riding alongside my 5 year old daughter every time. I recommend buying the multi-pass, it's worth the money. Especially, if you frequent the carousel as offered as we do. Also, pony rides are $5 for one ride, which is going around the circle once. Food truck Friday's ate the best. Kids play in the playground, there's tons of food trucks too choose from and there is even beer and wine sold (make sure you have your I.D.) for anyone 21 and over.
A little run down but still pleasant.

Carousel village is a fun place to visit with the family during on season. There is a little cafe with picnic tables, a train that takes the kids around RWP a bit, a huge carousel with tons of horses and a large playground that has equipment for toddler, preschool and school age children. Great place to enjoy during the warmer months!
Lots of fun for everyone! Food truck fridays in the summer is a great way to try different foods and listen to local music. Activities for kids is also a plus.
Awesome time great food so much to choose from. Great prices great entertainment. Lots of fun

name: Providence Ghost Tour
reviews: Super cool! Loved every historic story behind all the building. Great experience! Came from NY just because, and found this pamphlet at our hotel!! Loved it

Pretty neat ghost tour. Our guide, Nicky, was awesome! I'm not really into ghost stuff usually, but she had a lot of interesting stories about the history and tragedies that have happened on some of Providence's streets. Good for a nice evening walk, too. I imagine this tour is really busy in October. We went in June. Apparently, students from nearby colleges (i.e. Brown and RISD) will come up to tour groups and say "ghoooooosts!" Unfortunately, I didn't get to see that. I definitely recommend this tour!

This tour is a fun way to see the city. Good balance of humor and spooky moments. Nikki was fantastic and did a great job on our tour. She catered to our interests when we asked her for more history or story details that weren’t necessarily part of the tour. Would definitely recommend!
Had a great time exploring Providence and learning about its bloody and haunted history. Our guide was wonderful and gave a very entertaining performance.

A great way to spend an hour and a half on a beautiful September evening.
Not a scary tour, but interesting.  Especially if you enjoy history and the paranormal, as I do. Our guide, Stephanie, was fabulous.
Be prepared to walk a steep street or two - uphill!  Also, no restroom stop nor place to purchase a beverage.  Bring a water bottle!
Dinner on Thayer afterward made the evening complete!

name: Museum of Natural History and Planetarium
reviews:
They are so affordable that it is like going for free! Honestly because of the price I thought this place would be lame , but it wasn't it was interesting and fun especially on a winter day and u feel like getting out .

I think they should have a full gift shop with a quick snack bar ( popcorn and drinks ) just to bring some more money into the museum so that they can improve it a bit ...if they improved it a bit and charged $5 more to get in it would be worth returning to .

Otherwise it is a one time visit kind of place... definitely worth the price and at least going once
A little small but amazing value for the $2 price tag. I recommend adding the planetarium for the extra dollar.
This place has interesting exhibits and is only $2  to enter.  We spent just over an hour and was glad we took the time to visit.
cute little museum. the price tag meant i could easily decide to kill an hour or two here. the collection and information presented was solid & tailored to the area, & staff was nice!

Thoroughly impressed with the RWP Natural history museum, admittedly my expectations were low because of the small size & only a $2 admission, but I wasn’t disappointed! Absolutely a great hidden gem in RI. Check it out! 

& for $3 there is a planetarium show (ages 4 and up).

name: Lippitt House Museum
reviews: I really like it. Next time I will bring my family because this was a school trip.
Awesome! A must see..
Amazing place filled with family history and well preserved architecture. Loved the tour and would recommend to anyone with a desire to step back in time. Great late 19th century home.
They offer Victorian game night - so much fun!
Uniquely intact house museum, beautifully maintained and restored.

name: First Baptist Church in America
address: 75 N Main St, Providence, RI 02903, USA
reviews: Summer worship is Sundays at 10am, with no Sunday School. During the academic year, Sunday School and Adult Forum are at 10am with workshop service Sundays at 11am. Refreshments available after service downstairs. Free guided tours, Sundays, immediately after service, begin in the Manning Room downstairs.
Very nice staff a little difficult to find parking the day we were there.the church has a lot of history that I found very interesting. The pews are fascinating you have to see them.

Beautiful old church. They have a very informative video and then we walked around the church by ourselves.  Several very old documents and pieces our where you can see them close up. It is a beautiful place worth the visit!! Cost is a donation.
Must see in any visit. Amazing organ.

We walked all the way over from downtown to see the church during hours posted on the church’s website, only to find out from two very unfriendly women that no tours were being given today. Either adjust the info on your website and follow your own hours or don’t bother giving tours at all. Also, I personally have a real problem with any church locked up tight during reasonable hours at all. What if a parishioner just needed to go in to pray?  Very unwelcoming place!!!

name: Rooftop at the Providence G
reviews: When walking through the revolving door, go to your left and use the elevator (button R). This will take you to the Rooftop. I found it was quite spacious up there (bar, tables, couches). Pretty atmosphere. I didn't get the chance to try the food but the drinks were good. However, I did look at the menu and the cheapest thing was $12, and the food that I saw come out for other customers was presented nicely. Also, all the employees I experienced were accommodating and nice. I went to see live music (Radio Honey), and enjoyed myself. A nice spot in Providence.

The waitress was so nice and offered great service. I wish I could remember her name! The heated rooftop is such a nice feature. I don't drink alcohol but the bartender surprised me with a delicious mocktail as there weren't any on the menu. Great night.

We only went for drinks and sat outside at one of the fire tables. I must say that the staff is one of the best I have even encountered. They stopped by often asking if we needed anything. I not even sure who our actual server was, any staff that walked by checked in. The music was slightly loud outside and it did make it difficult to talk over it at times. With that I would still go back because the experience was amazing.

Cool rooftop bar if you’re looking to hook up or something. Place was pretty pretentious but you’ll have an awesome time. There wasn’t really a dance floor... and the drinks were okay. Really pricey though. The outside area is nice even had some blankets for the cold nights. There wasn’t much of a view though... and it wasn’t that high up. Gets packed around 11ish.

A little dramatic with rules but I understand. Music was cool. The crowd progressed into a younger crowd as the night went on. 

Strong drinks.

Great views. 

Lots of pretty people.

name: Burnside Park
reviews: Pretty clean for a park in the middle of downtown Providence. Interesting statues. Amazing trees. A sketch artist's dream. Lots of fun features. Close to dining, entertainment, shopping, and more. A great place to stop and rest.

I attend Church Beyond The Walls by the statue of General Burnside. I find it a peaceful place and a unfortunately chaotic issues of Kennedy Plaza. The other night waiting on my bus has the sun had set, and the gloaming headset in. The lighting was perfect to take a few snaps.

Nice park that has a lot going on, especially during summer. It is somewhat small, but has a really nice playground for kids. There’s always something going on here, from marching bands to political rallies to farmer’s markets. It’s definitely not the cleanest park in Providence, lots of huge rats running around at night. All in all a good park to come see on a summer day.
Nice park. Great atmosphere. Beautiful fountain. Super clean place.

Exciting and always changing. Every year they have the farmer's market, storytelling, dancers, an open garden, or movie time. Plus, sitting below the trees, listening to the music, and the water flowing on the large fountain it's just perfect 👍
And most of the time on my way back home I stop at the food trucks, and lemonade stand, or icecream stand. This year the city installed tables and chairs near the skating rink.

name: Memorial Park
address: S Main St, Providence, RI 02903, USA
reviews:
A beautiful a d inspiring gem in downtown Rhody. Tons of visual satisfaction to accompany a daytime stroll. Packed with monument and murals, this location has the perfect blend of a small metropolis and an eclectic renaissance. 

The diversity of the people, is reminiscent of Times Square without the lights and rush. The Universities in the area, provide a variety of people from all over the world. 

You'll be able to spend hours, just walking. Or, you can take advantage of the bicycles provided to the public, at a small cost. 

Would have given it a 5 star rating, if it wasn't for the traffic congestion and impatient drivers.
This was awesome to see with all of the veteran's memorials. I've never been to Providence and didn't know what to expect but I'm really glad we stopped by on our trip back to Boston.
Great memorial for veterans. There is also a sculpture including dozens of real discontinued guns embedded in a concrete pillar. It's quite moving.
Super fun to smoke a joint and look at the statues.
Love to come down by the water during a lunch break and have a moment of seclusion

name: Sky Zone Trampoline Park
address: 70 Pawtucket Ave, East Providence, RI 02916, USA
reviews: The whole family had a blast. Even those of us that just watched the others play had a great time. Even though it was the day before Thanksgiving all the staff friendly and helpful. Their prices are reasonable and safety definitely comes first there. I would feel more than comfortable bringing my nieces and nephews there any time. Honestly I think my sister and her husband had an even better time than the kids :-)

Horrible service! After waiting in line over 10 minutes to register 2, 11 year olds, the manager on shift was very unprofessional and extremely rude. Made it a priority to tell me the kids need it T-shirts to jump but doesn’t cross sell the socks. paying over $50 dollars to jump for 1.5 hrs, staff are restraining the kids from jumping in certain areas over no socks, when the “manager/cashier” DID NOT MENTION aside of t-shirts socks were required. When I approach the register for my socks she insisted “I TOLD HER, I ALREADY HAD SOCKS”. really? When I refused to agree with her, she Denied me service, and sent me to the next cashier. In her small mind my tone of voice was screaming. Just because I’ve been here in the past doesn’t necessary mean that I carry your socks everywhere. She failed to include the socks and wanted me to agree on her asking me and because I didn’t she refused to service me. Staff, super slow and very unorganized. If that’s the attitude of the manager in charge, I honestly can’t blame the horrible service. NEVER AGAIN will I step a foot in that place, I rather drive 30 plus miles!

Professional and safety! Grest place and clean! My children had a great time. They enjoyed it and went from center to center.  Each staff was uniqueand respectful! They will keep track and monitor while first were using the area they were in charge.  Thank you for making this experience great! Thank you! :)

Check in team member was very nice. There was another team member named Cristian who went above and beyond to answer my questions, help resolve my issues and interact with my children...
I have been to several other trampoline parks, it didn’t matter which socks my kids wore as long as they were jump socks. The option of buying sky zone socks or trading in your own socks is a little over the top with micromanaging. 
I had two toddlers with me and four 10 year olds. My older so called toddler was jumping with the big kids and was immediate yelled at and kicked off by a team member. When I looked on the main court there was a child who was quite smaller than my son jumping. I had to seek out a member and ask what the problem was. I was told that a parent could put any age on the waiver and it couldn’t be questioned, but because I was honest my son gets the boot? Also besides my kids, there were only two other kids jumping there, not crowed with the potential of someone getting hurt. Cristian was nice enough to explain to me that I had the option of bumping up my older toddler, the person who kicked my child off should have told me. 
Next there were not enough team members for every area to be open. My little ones had to wait to be able to go to an area they were “allowed” which was only wasting the time I had paid for. For the last 15 minutes of our time because there wasn’t anyone on the main court Christian allowed all the children in my party to jump together which I appreciated. If it wasn’t for him doing damage control my review would have been much worse. Still due to all these problems I will not be returning nor will I recommend any of my friends go there.

They don’t allow to jump less than 16 years old kids after 10 pm  on Saturday though they are opened up to midnight. They need to mention this rule on there on google maps listing. No body checks all the rules in your sky zone website. Please be transparent what matters most to the customer.

name: Lippitt Memorial Park
reviews: This is a nice little park with a pretty extensive playground it also has quite enough space to walk the dog or sit on the bench by the fountain. It also has lots of space has to have some lunch even fitted with some picnic tables. The landscaping is a little bit on the shabby side. Overall it's a friendly park next to a couple of nice restaurants and a nice neighborhood.

Love this park. Plenty of open space and the playground is in the middle away from all the traffic, super cool for the kiddos. Easy to get to. Farmers markets during the growing season. Great place to meet friends.
Nice straight trail and a nice open Park which holds different events throughout the such as yoga in the park couple running groups and it's a great place to hang around

Wonderful park in a nice residential area. Lots of great restaurants, bakeries and dessert shops nearby.  The water fountain is a nice place to gather. Lots of space for picnics and playing.  Big enough to kick around a soccer ball too.
Can't go wrong with a great family friendly Park wonderful location lots of fun stuff for kids lots of other kids there with their parents it was a good time

name: Lincoln Woods State Park
address: 2 Manchester Print Works Rd, Lincoln, RI 02865, USA
reviews: Its a huge place with lots of trails to walk dogs. Its quiet even when there appears to be a lot of people there. They have separate campsites with grills. Good place for a family outing or party - plenty of room for kids to run and play. Love it here!

Always a beautiful walk.  I find it too congested lately especially after 9am.  I found an early morning walk is best because there's less people and you can enjoy the gorgeous walk. So many trails to choose from. An if you're a dog mom or dad, its like an amusement park to them! Enjoy!! And happy trails!!

Lincoln Woods is a treasure. It's so close to urban areas, but it's a nature lovers paradise. There are amazing rock formations, great trails for hiking,mountain biking, and horseback rides. There are picnic areas with bbq grills, covered pavilions, a baseball field, and a lake with a small swimming area. It's a must see for anyone looking to get out and experience nature

Lincoln woods is beautiful. The views you can find on the lake are absolutely stunning, especially in spring or summer and during sunrise and set. However, the only downfall is that the water is kind of gross. The rest of the park is mostly clean, but the water is not very pleasant.
Nice and peaceful. Take a long walk around the park. Nice place for a bike ride. Cozy hideaway for a picnic with your lover. People love to swim here on those hot summer days.

name: Providence Art Club
reviews: The Providence Art Club is an absolute gem.  My husband and I attended the Winter Members’ Exhibition 2020 which was incredible.  We are not currently members but after attending this event we are now thinking about joining.  It was fantastic seeing them give away cash prizes to local artists!  If you haven't gone to the Providence Art Club you should stop by!
Pretty amazing collective of artists of varying talent. The fact that there is a thriving art club actually having their own building in downtown (sort of) Providence amazes me
Amazing old 1880 club with a bar and vintage leather furniture. Wish I was a member. Cool H P Lovecraft exhibit when I went
Outstanding restaurant and exhibits
It's like a restaurant i go over there for my job i like this place people are nice

name: Neutaconkanut Hill Conservancy
address: Legion Memorial Dr, Providence, RI 02909, USA
reviews: Can’t find many good hiking spots in Rhode Island, but this is one of them. There’s plenty of trails to explore, ranging in difficulty to accommodate all. There’s also a ton of overlooks with a great view of downtown Providence. I went here in the winter, and while it was nice that I was one of, if not the only person there, it was also quite icy in some spots. Can’t wait to check this place out once it warms up!

Nice unexpected location for some quiet time in the woods and nature.  Nice well kept trails.  I would recommend keeping an image of the trail map on you because trail blazes are not super frequent or consistent but easy to follow with the map as reference.

Living the city life wishing for hiking trails without having to travel an hour to get to one? We were so pleasantly surprised by the sense of remoteness of the trails. There are many trails, all levels of difficulty, and are well maintained!
Well maintained hiking trails. Parking can be a bit difficult over weekends
Nice walk in the woods for being so close to the city. Good place to take your dog

name: Temple to Music
address: F C Greene Memorial Blvd, Providence, RI 02910, USA
reviews: Wonderful place. Beautiful and soothing. The dog loves the surrounding area also. Great place to throw a ball and just unwind. You get the beautiful temple, the water and a massive greens area! Thanks Providence! Great job w Roger Williams Park.
Beautiful park, good place to hike and photography.

Great place for weddings, concerts, picnics,  or just relaxing in the park, this is a great classic style white marble temple.  It's open to all and surrounded by great views and in a natural amphitheater. Nice in both summer and winter.  Great winter sledding in the hills on each side.
Always find great things happening that I can participate in going on at the temple a lot of it is private but they love having company and sharing and having a good time a great place to meet people
Nice cozy spot to do photography. Play music, hold an event at

name: Betsey Williams Cottage
reviews: One time home of a descendant of the founder of our 13th state,  her home has been carefully maintained to reflect how it might have looked when this was her farm. The grounds have changed greatly over the years but her farmhouse is a historic piece of Rhode Island.
A nice place that just hang out and chill when you are at that Park... just trying to imagine back in time what it was like for the people who lived there
Spent half day here. It was a good day. Was really exhausted and happy at the end. Don't be lazy and walk for a while in the area, you will find the area a beautiful one.
Betsey Williams Cottage is a very nice looking place. Also lots of birds and green areas. Must see it in person.
Beautiful in the Fall.

name: Ladd Observatory
reviews: Ladd Observatory is an amazing place. I am an astronomy enthusiast, but I did not have any chance to go to any observatories before here. I liked the place and saw the moon through their huge telescope. The building is pretty old, but you can see the history of telescopes and machines, sort of. The staff and people are super nice and helpful.

They have a bunch of nice events open to the public, check their website.

The grounds are also a great place to hang out and relax, read a book, picnic, whatever you like.

They have weekly (Tuesday evenings) free space viewings, with telescopes set up to show various interesting things and staff to explain what you're seeing and answer questions. If you like space stuff, it's a kick. Be sure to check their site before you go, as their hours are weather-dependent.
What a beautiful, historic site! Ladd Observatory is operated by Brown University, and hosts weekly observation and lecture sessions during the year. Be sure to check them out on a clear night!
Very cool place with some dedicated volunteers and staff. Interesting museum to complement the telescopes.

name: Rhode Island Irish Famine Memorial
address: Providence River Greenway, Providence, RI 02903, USA
reviews: Riveting and compelling artwork.

Tiny park in a good spot of town. It does worth to sit in for 10-15 minutes when the weather is nice. If you're living here and working around downtown area, I suggest this place as a to-go location around noon.
A beautiful tribute! Love the location and it's done so well.
Such a lovely spot with a memorial that's worth learning about.
Worth checking out if you are in the area, a good place to sit and collect your thoughts by the river.

name: Blackstone Park
reviews: One of the nicest neighborhood parks in Providence. Sunrise walks are great! I enjoyed starting my day here. Well groomed walking paths.
great place to exercise, and take your pet for a walk
Very nice for short walks with my dog! Clean and easy to stay on the path
Love taking walks there. Been yrs since I've been but went there for a walk with bf . Was nice out
A nice and relaxing place, really relieves me of all my stress.😋😊

name: Seekonk Grand Prix
address: 1098 Fall River Ave, Seekonk, MA 02771, USA
reviews: My kids love this place. Great place for indoor and outdoor. Food is pricey but there are places around where you can go and eat and come back.
Very fun place. Great for family events like birthdays and stuff like that. This place has fun rides and arcade games
It was great. Lots to do. Their Not so scary Halloween was really cute. The Mickey Mouse was quality. Very well done. They have everything.
Great place to spend a day. Kids loved the two different tracks and had lots of fun with the all day pass.

Great little place for the under 12 crowd.  My wife and I have been bringing the kids (and now grandkids) since 2000.  They always have a blast and there is a pretty good selection to keep the kids busy.  My wife and I sometimes play the mini-golf course after a dinner date when we're in the area. Many time the mini-golf course is empty except for us and it's nice to have the entire course to ourselves.

name: Cathedral of Saints Peter & Paul
reviews: The Cathedral is absolutely beautiful. Breathtaking architecture has been maintained and restored throughout the years, and the structure is truly an architectural marvel for anyone of any denomination to appreciate. The ornate design is paralleled only by the acoustics which lend to a truly magical experience when listening to voices and instrumentation in concert or during Catholic mass. The pipe organ is a marvel in and of itself! Numerous performance groups hold concerts at the Cathedral, and Roman Catholic Mass is celebrated weekly. Parking is limited and it is best to use the metered parking on the main road or to pay to park in a lot. Wear appropriate shoes for walking on cobblestones and uneven sidewalks, and scarves and gloves are a must in the winter months when the side streets leading to the Cathedral act like a frigid wind tunnel. There is ample seating for just about any event, due to the building's immense size. Bathrooms are clean and fully accessible. An elevator is available for those who require it.

A beautiful old cathedral in the heart of Providence. They have the largest mechanical operation organ in North America. The square outside could use some work. There are signs of neglect that don't present the church well. Would be a fine place to celebrate mass. I recommend visiting with a friend who can play the organ!
Beautiful architecture, beautiful mass. A place to just sit in God's presence.

Beautiful. Classic. Visually mesmerizing. Historic. Astounding organ. Fantastic stained glass. Interesting paintings. Wonderful marble.
Old-style pews with heating ducts running down the center. Complicated walking routes for receiving the Sacraments in an orderly manner. Has parking. Easy to reach by way of RIPTA or walking. No bike rack that I have seen.

A beatiful Roman Catholic cathedral with a fascinating history. I love this church.💖
 This is the church of our beloved Bishop of The Diocese of Providence. A MUST visit for all Roman Catholics in RI.
The very first time I attended Mass there, at the 100th anniversary of Fatima , I was in the crowd  picture in RI Catholic!!!

name: Pomham Rocks Lighthouse
reviews: You can see this beautiful lighthouse from the east coast greenway. Best time to see it is at sunset!
Beautiful lighthouse from a distance. Got great pictures on an overcast day. Wish they would do tours again.
Be prepared to walk a distance down a bike trail to get a view. You've got to peak though brush to get a glimpse. But still worth it if you're a lighthouse lover as I am.
Pretty lighthouse

The restoration they did is amazing! I visited this on a light house tour so I got a very nice explanation of the changes they did and got to see inside. The crew that worked on this lighthouse is really passionate about the work they did and keeping the history of it as alive as possible. I totally recommend going to check it out!

name: First Unitarian Church of Providence
reviews:
Warm, open and welcoming congregation.
Intelligent, open-hearted minister whose preaching is uplifting and challenging.
Amazing choir and music.
A huge array of programs to expand human connections and nurture the spirit.
A haven for all types of families and people of all ages.
Many opportunities to assist in charitable outreach to the larger Providence community.
and so much more...
I love this place.
Great community!
Thoughtful community of people who are dedicated to creating a safe place where each member is encourage in their spiritual growth.
A truly Welcoming Church with a large congregation of nice folks.
Great place for a meeting felt at home here

name: Fargnoli Park And Water Park
reviews: A splendid park! Basketball courts and a seasonal splash pad. There is a little lending library stand too. Picnic tables are available. Decently gated in so no huge concern of kids running into traffic on Smith St. Some challenging climbing pieces on one side that are not typical for playgrounds and then a small kid section as well. A set of regular swings and a set of baby swings as well as a chair swing.
It’s a nice park but no longer allows dogs. There are signs posted at each entrance.

My fiance and I love love love this park! Always clean and maintained. A great place to bring family. Fully fenced and the patrons are always politely and completely personable. There are a lot of parks in Providence but this is the only park we frequent! The parking is a little tight but it is not a far walk when the weather is nice!

The park has a baseball field and basketball court with both a toddler and 5 and you playground areas. We enjoyed the first food truck event this past Thursday. There was even a guy singing and playing the guitar.

Great little hidden gem. Doesnt look like much from the road, but this is a really nice space to get away from it all and spend some time in nature. Nice space to walk and there is a ton of playground equipment for the kids. You can go sledding here in the winter too, which is great when it snows. The kids absolutely love it here!

name: Save The Bay Center
address: 100 Save the Bay Dr, Providence, RI 02905, USA
reviews: Easy access to Narragansett Bay, kayak launch, fishing, parking, walking trails, dog friendly (on leash), great birdwatching! Managed by nonprofit so when you visit give Save The Bay some love.
It's a great location to visit. On a nice day, take advantage of the walking path along the water. Terrific views of the bay.

Save the Bay is an amazing non-profit in Rhode Island doing important work on environmental education, and keeping the Narragansett bay clean. They are committed to keep the Bay open for the enjoyment of all who wish to fish or just enjoy a quiet, beautiful afternoon on the Bay.
Great place for events! So peaceful to entertain guests and watch the sunset. Do not sit on the picnic tables unbalanced or they WILL FLIP.
Perfect place ! Sunbeam was there for me :)

name: Merino Park
reviews: This is a great place to come play some sports during the summer time. But the only thing is that there is a project right by which makes everything uncomfortable because they are well known for their gang activities. So you can visit at your own risk lol. I went there to play soccer on the field and played basketball and I was fine. I'm pretty sure you'll be fine as well.😂🤷🏾‍♂️
Great park, awesome soccer games!
good park i lost my virginity near the river
It's a great place to hang out with friends and then go to the bike trail

The other review must be written by people who have lived in the area their whole lives. It's basically a strip of grass along the highway behind a housing project where mad-men on ATV's go tearing up the grass.

If you live within walking distance and need a place to walk your dog it beats the streets, but that's about the best thing I can say about it.

name: Governor John Notte Memorial Park
address: 1801 Douglas Ave, North Providence, RI 02904, USA
reviews: Nice little location, sort of an oasis on the lake, not far from the busy, crowded city.  I attended a professional conference here, but seems like it's really made for weddings, showers, and local town ceremonies.  If you get a chance to attend, go check it out.

I love that the kids have easy access to water without waves that don't knock them down. They still have sand to play in period there's a playground right on the beach so they can go back-and-forth from the water to the park. Perfect place for them to burn off some energy

Major improvements have been made to this park. Great new playground, great swimming area with beach sand, great place to take the family - also it's nice and clean. It has tennis courts and a  softball field. The only thing lacking could use better designation of parking in back lot.
A little bit of nature right in the city's backyard
Great place to sit or walk around outside. Nice, friendly, a lot in one place. Good landscape that's nicely taken care of.

name: Wanskuck Park
reviews: Really nice, spacious park. There’s huge open fields and a trail that goes through the woods. It’s sort of an underground dog park, so be prepared for dogs on and off leash. Owners are friendly and responsible, though, and the size of the park makes it easy to find your own space.
My dog's favorite park! Always friendly people and pets there, my dog has made quite a few canine buddies and is always so excited to go there
Awsome place to walk your dog. Parking not the greatest.
Great place for the dogs.. Unfortunately these those few who do not pick up after their puppy's poop 💩🤔
Great dog park. Everyone so friendly.

name: Rhode Island Museum of Science and Art (RIMOSA)
reviews: The Rhode Island Museum of Science & Art is a MUST VISIT location! Do not let the size of this place deter you from visiting because even though this place is small, you will not get this type of service and one on one interactions with staff anywhere else!! I am honestly in shock that they ONLY charge $5.00 per person, because everything you get is worth WAY MORE! A visit is typically 2 hours long if you go through each and every activity. The staff were absolutely amazing and they really took their time with each child and parent to make sure they were getting the best experience possible. We did some spin art, and the woman who was there was so patient with my daughter who had never done spin art before. I wish I caught her name. But we chatted away like we knew each other for years. Truly hands down the best time I have ever had with my family at a museum like this. Do not pass up an opportunity to visit this place.
This place is not new, but the owner is taking care about everything.  Good place to spend 30 min 1 hour with kids 3-9 years old.
Awesome place with friendly staff. Rachel is an outstanding educator who is very gifted with children. She made our child's birthday party a huge success. Cannot recommend this place enough.
Small, enjoyable science museum. Friendly staff. Worth a visit.

Such a reasonable price and so many completely interactive exhibits. Plan on a 2 hours visit. The science of what makes things work is awesome. Adults had as much fun as the kids. Don't overlook this gift of a place.

name: Twin River Casino Hotel
address: 100 Twin River Rd, Lincoln, RI 02865, USA
reviews: Twin River is a great Casino in New England.. they have a variety of food a nice restaurant or bar and grill and then take out food courts along the sides.. Some table games venues and small concerts, which arebetter to see. 2 floors of slots non-smoking and smoking... variety of slots from one cent all the way to high roller high stakes pulls... Incentives,free slot play for returning customers... Live music and many bars I love it...

Love the vibes here haven't taken photos but I will. I recommend this casino . has a second floor for smokers . first floor is smoking. Machine change often . lots of new machines. I love the people there. Enjoy .

Nice place. The hotel is so cute! Went here you see a concert (Gretchen Wilson). It's an intimate setting, which is always good to see a table favorite dinner or band. However, if you're looking to do anything other than sit and watch, ya might want to try another venue. People were escorted out for dancing 2 steps away from their chairs.

As a preferred player I’m always treated well by the hosts. My overall experience has been great and the food, entertainment, and service are awesome. 
Fred and Steve’s Steakhouse is awesome as well. 
Awesome service and Food. I highly recommend dining at the delicious establishment.

The only problem I had was with the service at Johnny Rockets on Tuesday night on the 1st floor. The waitresses were curt and not friendly at all. We never got a welcome at all. Drinks took forever to receive and we were never asked if our dinner was ok after we received it. It wasn't busy at all. The entire staff was chatting and not paying attention to customers. I work for Marriott Hotels and understand how important these comments can help. 
Other than that, we had a great time in the casino. Every one else was friendly. The establishment was clean and we will definitely come back. 
Thanks for replying to my comment.

name: Conimicut Point Park
reviews: Conimicut point is on the west shore of Narragansett bay.  Nice place for a walk. At low tide you can walk out on the sand bar on the point and get a great view of the light house that helps vessels navigate the channel .

Love this place it's beautiful it's great it's a fantastic place to bring your dog and you can bring them there year-round just make sure you pick us up to yourself having the peninsula go out to the lighthouse is awesome especially for the puppies.

I love Conimicut Point Park, it is especially peaceful during early evening. Personally, for me, it is a tranquil place to do some thinking. The light house does it for me, as well as the ocean smell!! I have gone there for many years and left with a new perspective on life. Highly recommended!!!

Close to home very few people know this place; very nice. Many people come for fishing. Fresh air, relaxed and not crowded. I do not go to the beach, but really enjoy the relaxing view of the ocean. Picnic areas available. Playground also available.
I love conimicut point its peaceful and no one really bothers you and its quiet

name: Sabin Point Park
reviews: I really like coming here fo fishing, but it's also a great place to go just to hang out and relax. Plenty of park benches and picnic tables, so if you're looking for a nice outdoorsy spot to bring the family for lunch, you might want to try here. No swimming is allowed, but there is plenty of room to do other things. It's a really nice place, and definitely gets a recommendation from me.

Small park with a lot of things to do. There’s a trail that runs through the park, a dock to fish on, sports fields and basketball courts, and a beach. The beach isn’t great, there’s tons of glass and it’s pretty rocky/full of broken shells, but there is restoration work ongoing. Nice view of Providence and the bay. Wish there were bathrooms here.
No e place to go to take a walk by the water or play at the park. People launch boats here also. The beach area is definitely not for swimming but you could walk and look for sea glass or shells.

One day, we looked at Google maps and saw Sabin Point - what an unexpected, delightful gem! No swimming in the water yet (environmental cleanup efforts are still ongoing) but for a clean, quiet, tidy relaxing picnic, it is simply one of the best in Rhode Island!

One of the places I love. Lots of fun here and so many things to do. I am sure that if you are local you have been here before. If you did not yet, come here quickly before it will get too cold  ( That doesn't affect how beautiful the place is, just less things to do)

name: Colt State Park
reviews: GREAT PLACE! Went recently to try and escape cabin fever. Beautiful location on Narragansett Bay. Huge. Easy to get around. Wonderful bike path. Playground. Beach. Kids will love it.
An amazing place to visit. Very peaceful to walk around at, and plenty of trails if you prefer the woods. The water makes for great pictures and it's my favorite place to walk my dog at!
I always loved this place. I took my daughter here for the first time a few months ago on a good day and she loved it. Very open and quiet place to go to just relax

Beyond beautiful.  So many great areas to walk, photograph, reflect.  It's a beautiful drive with the ocean right beside you.  It's one of my quick fix drives if I'm craving the salty air :) The drive getting there is just as fun and beautiful.  A great place and town to get lost in.

Nothing beats Colt State Park !!! Beautiful ocean views lots of things for families to do including a bike path and skateboard park. Lots of barbecue and picnic benches for everyone to enjoy just an all-around great adventure please don't miss this wonderful Park in Bristol Rhode Island !!!!

name: Dexter Training Ground
address: Parade St & Willow St, Providence, RI 02909, USA
reviews:
I fly FPV drones, and I love to fly at Dexter park..  I try to only fly micro drones there since it is a pretty busy park with a lot of people around..  So far nobody has complained on me, they seem to enjoy watching me fly..  People say there is a lot of drug use associated with Dexter Park. However I have not experienced any of that thank goodness..  Although there is usually a couple homeless people somewhere in the park, they don’t bother anyone..
 If you have a dog, Dexter is a great park for you..

Nice park, especially if you have dogs or kids. Cool statue, good view of the Armory, and exercise stations throughout. Also has a bocci ball court and chess/checkers boards on some of the tables. Great place to enjoy a day off.
Great for kids, and has a softball field, and volleyball ready.. Great for chess as well
its have  nice playground for the kids and a lot space to walk and breath fresh air ...
A fabulous park with bocce and a new volleyball court. Farmers Market on Thursday nights in the summer. All in the face of the Cranston Castle.

name: Goddard Memorial State Park
address: 1095 Ives Rd, East Greenwich, RI 02818, USA
reviews: The trees are just beautiful. Great trails along the beach. You can also go horseback riding
Goddard Park is a wonderful and relaxing place to go walk my dogs and work on some training. My husband had also gotten some amazing photos of them as well with the beautiful scenery!
Great place. Clean beach, trail in the woods, great time exploring around the coast. There are many fields for sports, picnics. No group too big or too small.
Great walking trails..they are legally horse trails so follow the (State) rules curb your dog and let the horses pass.

I moved states and this place was right up the road. So I thought I would check it out. The park is usually not too busy on weekdays. You will see quite a few people doing their thing. Golf, running, walking, taking pictures and riding horses, on the weekends the sky is the limit, within park rules anyway, is well maintained. The weekends are the best, the families are so happy and friendly.

name: Biomes Marine Biology Center
address: 6640 Post Rd, North Kingstown, RI 02852, USA
reviews: I enjoyed the fun day out. But $33 for 2 adults and a child was kind of pricey. The reason I say that is because you can walk through the center in less than 15 minutes. Other than that it was great to be able to pet different types of fish and sharks.
Great place for the whole family! Great demonstrations. Went on a busy day, but there are so many exhibits to see. Gift shop was reasonably priced so the kids left with something!

I was excited to find a little aquarium/biology center so close. I was a little disappointed at some of the enclosures as they were small for some of the livestock and didn't offer any places for the fish to get away from the banging hands of children. There was a lot of information about the exhibits for the size of the facility. One of my main dislikes however was the removal of a puffer fish from it's tank, to be plunked into a room temperature tank and "puffed up" for onlookers. Causing a puffer to puff up can be very detrimental to it's health, and they can take hours to resume a normal metabolic rate. I was very surprised to see a "marine biology center" doing this. I'm sure it's a big hit for the kids, but really at the fish's expense. All in all it's worth the trip if you're local and the price was good. I would urge others and hopefully them to try and take a little more precaution for their livestock's wellbeing.

I can’t say enough good things about this place. Our children just love to visit. The touch tanks are a huge hit and my kids can spend all afternoon going from one area to the next. We love the mix of tropical and native species in the tanks. They have a nice play area with books and a puppet show stage for kids to use. It’s a nice place to go to in the dead of winter when the kids are bored.  So many learning experience here. ❤️

This place is interesting and has some potential with much needed improvements .

They have lots of tanks that u can touch sea life including baby sharks, star fish and horse shoe crabs.  Even the ones u can not touch u can get up close to. It was fun.

However I would not return, the lobsters were kept in very small tanks , as well as the snapping turtle . There was a long eel , and a fish they called lucky that was also in a small tank .

Most tanks were cloudy and filled with Alagae 
I can not support a place that upholds this sort of treatment to make a dollar .

They really need a bit of cleaning and invest a bit of money in bigger tanks for some of the sea creatures . If they did this I would recommend this place and give it 5 stars.

Until then , I barely want to give them 2

name: Clouds Hill Museum
address: 4157 Post Rd, East Greenwich, RI 02818, USA
reviews: The best kept secret in R.I. ! This mansion has so much history and amazing views of the bay it once sat on 500 acres! Upon entering Clouds Hill your eyes are met with towering ceilings in each room with very ornate surrounds. Each fireplace is a marvel to behold, and there are many! Ann is the owner and is there to chat with she is a real gem and gave us hot cider after the tour! The workmanship is beyond words! Do yourself a big favor and take this tour you will be amazed!

The amount of history that can be learned here is amazing!
Have you seen the mansions in Newport and wondered what it would be like gowing up there? At clouds hill just chat with anne.
I hope to return in the spring.
Surrounded in history, I learned a lot from volunteering there, and our guide was knowledgeable, and passionate!

We attended the Clue like mystery event on November 3, 2018, and it was outstanding!!! My 6 year old daughter is special needs (autistic) and the staff/actors were incredible how they treated her and overall how professional and fun they all were. I can't say enough on what a great night out it was and one my family will remember for a long time.
An amazing original collection, spanning the globe, a feast for the eyes!  Very informative, friendly staff,   awesome!

name: Donigian Park
reviews: A very nice, relaxing park to come to for some peace and quiet. The Woonasquatucket River runs right next to it and provides some great views. There are often a lot of geese and ducks around the park, which is nice except for the fact that their poop is everywhere. Not much you can do about that though. There’s a nice bike path that runs right along the river, and a lot of open space for activities. Overall, a great park!
Very peaceful place to sit by the water and enjoy the animals. A little hiding spot to relax and enjoy nature
Nice park . More green than playground.. needs a toddler playground for the little ones or more things to do.
Great park with plenty opportunities for outdoor activities
This places is just beautiful. !

name: Old State House
reviews: You probably know the place. I was here last time years ago, and I think the place could use some work done. Cool spot, hope they will work and improve conditions it a little.
Beautiful old building, why isn't it a museum? Historical society housed in it was closed on Saturday when we visited.

I visited this place in early June'13. The building itself has a nice appeal to it. It looks old , impressive and important. But for some reason there was no name board on the building. We have to look into google maps to figure out that it was the old state house.

From the looks of things I would say that the old state house is in need of some repair, while I have never been inside the old state house I can attest to the fact that the outside looks amazing, an historic wonder located on Benefit street. I would suggest walking up the facade from South Main and taki g in the long sweeping g front lawn and walk way
It's not open to the public on Saturdays

name: Escape Room Rhode Island
address: 560 Mineral Spring Ave Suite 2110, Pawtucket, RI 02860, USA
reviews: We had a great experience here! A group of 7 of us took on Professor X and defeated him with only minutes to spare! Challenging, fun puzzles to solve. The mechanisms in the rooms were neat to mess with. Staff seemed a bit lack-luster in greeting us and prepping us for the room, not very invigorating or setting the mood, but once we were in the room we were off! Will definitely be coming back for another adventure!
First time going and it was so much fun! John was super helpful and nice. Fun for the whole family and gets your brain working! would give more than 5 stars if I could!

First time at the Escape Room for this group of friends. They were able to solve the puzzles and find the Diamond at The Heist Room. The staff was super friendly and helpful. They want to go back to solve the next room!  We will definitely recommend this to our family/friends.

My wife and I are around 100 rooms now and have done all the rooms within a 1 hour radius of Providence. This place had some poor reviews and so I want to kind of give it a 5 star review with an explanation. For those who have done some rooms before, The heist will be a bit too easy, I think we made it out in about 24 minutes or less with just the two of us. I believe that this is a great room for people who have never done one before though. The puzzles show you what kinds of things you do and how they can tie together, and its design is fun enough. This is likely the specific place and room that I would likely have people go that are asking what a room is like to see if they would enjoy it more generally. We have yet to play The Contraption at this location and that appears to be their more difficult room for people like us and I will update this review with those details.
A great night out! Staff was fantastic and the room was challenging and exciting!

name: Caratunk Wildlife Refuge - Audubon Society of RI
reviews: On a recent sunny Sunday afternoon I decided to tape the Patriots game and drive over to the Caratunk Wildlife Refuge on a beautiful early November day and it was one of the nicest days I have spent this fall.  The trails were all well maintained and the fall colors were spectacular.  I went in the early afternoon before most of the wildlife comes out, but the fall colors were breath taking.  If you are looking for an area with a variety of trail types from flat to slight hills this is your area.
Nice little 1 and a half mile loop near the Attleboro area. Quiet with a nice view of a brook and a few bridges along the trail.

I've been wanting to hike here for about 2 months now, and I finally got my chance today!  Perfect weather day for this lovely place.  I was there for about 3 hours total.  Walked the Perimeter Trail in it's entirety, as well as the Hemlock, Observation Trail, and Muskrat Pond Loops  (saving Cole's Brook for a subsequent visit).  All trails were fairly easy (just watch your step around protruding stones and tree roots) and very well marked/blazed.  This lovely Refuge ranges from the outright beautiful to the sublime.  Well worth a day visit, and I strongly recommend (after liberally dousing with insect repellent) taking ample time to revel in the sights/smells/sounds (barring civilization noises) everywhere.  Everything from the miniscule and humble to magnificent is on display here.  Can't wait to go again!
An amazing place. Very green and beautiful with long trails that can make you feel like you're trekking through the jungle. Stay away from Hemlock Loop unless you're up for a real adventure.

I have been going here since my teens , although I haven't been in many years , I'm sure it's just as beautiful and serene as my last time there ! I'm due for a good hike , think I will pay a visit soon .

name: Superman Building
reviews:
Came here from Boston in a day trip.
According to other reviews, is this ruined building?
What a pity..... 
Give energy to the downtown again!   ;)
Strange to me that its left abandoned even with it being a prominent building for Rhode Island. Hopefully companies invest and move back in.

It's really remarkable for a building of this scale and architecture to also be quite tall. Even more remarkable is how it has remained the tallest building in the city for all the 90 years of its existence and the fact that it is OLDER than New York's Empire State Building by a few years. It's sad that the building has been abandoned for years and that it is in danger of being demolished. There is a website dedicated to saving the building for those who wish to help (Google 'Save Superman' to find the website).

Bank of America, evil corporate crooks, abandoned this fine piece of 1920s architecture in 2012. It has since fallen into disrepair and somewhat resembles a gray tombstone over Providence, easily seen driving by on I-95. The building itself is quite handsome, it's not called the "Superman Building" for nothing; and could look nice again one day. Hopefully it will be restored to its former glory and host tenants worthy of its dignity as the tallest building in Rhode Island - something the culturally bankrupt bean counters at Bank of America could not appreciate when they fled in a cowardly fashion from the streets of Providence and left this historic building unoccupied.
Always know I'm back in RI when I see this building. It's as beautiful inside as it is on the outside.

name: Gaspee Days Committee
address: 2 E View St, Warwick, RI 02888, USA
reviews: Been on the Committee for many years and still love the events especially the Arts & Crafts show, always a great time. Lots of food and music also things for the kids. Don' t forget to get your raffle tickets to help the parade.
My cousin lives in the village. It was my first time and I had a blast at the parade
Love this every year. The town should help the Gaspee committee with additional funding support.
Amazing Day! Best Arts and Crafts Fair I have ever been to. Beautiful location, nice people and fun activities for All ages. Put it on your Must Go List Every Year!!
Beautiful little park with a small gazebo

name: Battleship Cove
address: 5 Water St, Fall River, MA 02721, USA
reviews: Such a great way to teach youngsters about a part of our history that we never want repeated, but must also never forget. There is a lot to see here, so give yourself at least 3 hours, not including lunch.  I also suggest watching some YouTube videos about the USS Massachusetts before coming.  You'll appreciate the exhibits a lot more that way.

We love this place. We brought our youngest son here for his birthday because of his fascination with ships and subs. This is a good place to take your kids for an adventure and at the same time appreciate history and let them know the bravery of our heroes who gave up their lives for our freedom. We got to see where they eat or sleep and if you want to spend the night there too and experience how they sleep on their tiny beds. We got to experience how uncomfortable they live in such tight space and still have the courage and dedication to serve the country which teaches us also to be grateful for every little things we have in their expense costing their lives.

Outstanding! Definitely a must see if you are ever in the area. The ships are massive but all the donated memorabilia really made my visit one to remember. Plan to spend some time there because you will get lost in all the things to explore.

This museum is awesome. The exhibits are informative and the ships are incredible. You can go most anywhere on the ships. I've done the sleepover too. That is really fun. Highly recommend you check this place out.

As a US NAVY VETERAN I was thoroughly impressed. My 15 year old grandson was full of questions and I was honored to have the answers. We did not have time to visit all the ships but will return next year to finish where we left off! KUDOS to all who make this history stay alive!!

name: Snake Den State Park
reviews: I'm just confused by this park and its trails. It has potential, but the trails are SO poorly marked and not maintained, it's nearly impossible not to get lost. Additionally, there is the element of hunting?! There's a sign at the trail entrance (which I have never seen at a state park) warning hikers that they must wear orange during certain parts of the year. You'd have no way of knowing this prior to going. Also, while you're on the trails, there are hunting signs that imply that you are actually walking in the middle of where people could be hunting. They say "No hunting beyond this point", and you're clearly in the hunting area as opposed to the not hunting area. There are also signs that say "Bow and arrow hunting only" right next to the trail! Bizarre. It's really too bad because it's a vast area that has great hiking potential.

I visited here 3 weeks ago and I traveled about half an hour to just not be able to go into the park because of hunting season so without a vest or bright color jackets you cannot access and if you do you most likely will be shot or God forbid your dog gets shot by some idiot that needs bright colors to distinguish a deer from a dog or person! So be aware of this.
Great place to go near Providence to get out in Nature. Remember to wear orange during hunting season. Sort of easy to get lost, but there's a trail map if you look on AllTrails.

Really nice park to go to, especially in the fall. There’s a multitude of trails to choose from, and none of the ones I’ve walked have been too exerting. I’m looking forward to visiting the tulip farm when I get a chance. From what I understand, they are planning on developing the park a bit more soon. Good place to stroll around in nature and relax.
Nice walk with open areas and wooded areas.  It definitely wasn't the right time of year for tulips, but it was the right time of year for some peaceful walking!

name: Warwick City Park - Buttonwoods Beach
address: Steven O' Connor Blvd, Warwick, RI 02889, USA
reviews: One of the few parks in Rhode Island that is just as beautiful during winter as it is at any other point in the year. Very nice, clean beach with a great view of the bay. The surrounding area has a small playground for kids, and dogs are welcome. Good place to come read a book on a nice day.

This is my favourite beach when it comes to little ones.  The water isn't deep, there are no real waves or undertow. My kids always enjoy the periwinkle and hermit crabs. The is plenty of shade in the play ground area.  It's the perfect mix of sun, salt water, shade and activities. There it's usually a lemonade truck in the parking lot too.
Great place to spend the afternoon with family. Enjoy a nice swim while listening to some tunes by Fred Mostly.
Nice park and beach. Lots of cute little crabs -- away from the main beach. Nice paved walking trail.
Beautiful park located in Warwick city. Quiet and secluded in the winter months. Busy and full of life during the summer. Really clean public beach, Restroom during summer months.

name: Rocky Point State Park
address: 33 Rocky Point Ave, Warwick, RI 02889, USA
reviews: Great place to take the dog or kids. Lots of shoreline access with a nice walking trail. This place used to be a popular amusement park if you didn't know. The rides are long gone but you can still see some remnants of the area as it was when they were there.
GREAT place for a walk, run, etc, with or without the dog (leashed)! Plenty of free parking, terrific views of the Bay, and a fishing area! Bring your lunch and enjoy a relaxing picnic. Fly kites!!

Rocky Point is a wonderful place to walk, picnic or fish. It's clean. A very easy walk along the path. You can bike there also. There is handicapped parking available with a beautiful view of Narragansett Bay.
Love this place. Walking, biking, sitting, or whatever you want. It's all great to do here. I especially like getting Sea Glass here.

They done a wonderful job and parking now at old exit so many cars can fit walking path nice even when busy the dock will be another attraction and be selling chowder and clam cakes again i hear fantastic while keeping open spaces for public AMEN JESUS H CHRIST

name: Newport Car Museum
address: 1947 W Main Rd, Portsmouth, RI 02871, USA
reviews: We planned a trip to Rhode Island just to visit Newport Car Museum! We visited during the Hoods Up Weekend event for my birthday. They do the hoods up event once a month and it was DEFINITELY worth the 3 hour drive to come and see! They had quite an array of cars to view as well as many employees that were always readily available, should you wish to ask any questions about any car. They were quite knowledgeable and I enjoyed talking with them. At the end of the day, it doesn't matter if you are a Chevy person or a Ford person. People come here together to unite as one and put their differences aside to truly enjoy all the beauty bestowed upon us in the car world.
