There is a nice sitting area as well and a small area to enjoy a coffee and reading materials. We did notice a room down a hallway that had some inventory inside that was not on display. There is also a car simulation room for adults and kids. There are staff to help everyone who wishes to try their hand at a race. It was a really nice visit and also were able to purchase many things in the Newport Car Museum gift shop. Overall, we really enjoyed their Ford collection and were quite grateful we were able to attend the hoods up weekend event and strongly encourage others to also consider visiting this museum.

We were headed to Rhode Island to stop at a couple of our favorite shopping spots, and I wanted to do something fun while we were there...I found this car museum online and it looked interesting. My husband and I aren't really into cars, but we do appreciate nice cars and enjoy history on almost any subject. We really enjoyed this museum! The cars were beautiful and beautifully maintained. We just watched Ford vs Ferrari, so I liked the Ford Shelby exhibit because I knew a little something about it. We happened to end up there on "hoods up" weekend, which was definitely a bonus. If we went again I would definitely aim to go when the hoods are up. There were art deco chairs scattered around and it added to the style of the museum. The ticket price was $18 an adult and $15 for military (my husband is a vet but we didn't ask if that counted for military pricing and we paid standard admission). Included in the admission fee is a turn on the car simulator (Forza) which I seriously suck at but it was still fun! Overall it was an enjoyable afternoon and definitely worth visiting.

I'm a local, and I have no idea why I put off visiting this museum for so long. I'm a big fan of cars, and they have a spectacular collection. There's a little bit of everything, from Modern Exotics to 50s Classics. The museum is very well laid-out, with great R and video presentations along with the cars. The staff is very friendly and helpful, I really enjoyed chatting with them about some of the different vehicles.

I went with my father and younger brother, I had bought them tickets for Christmas. We had an excellent time, and I highly recommend it!

Great selection of cars! Up close and personal, videos, simulator room. This was not on my agenda for the day, but I'm glad I went in. I really enjoyed it. Match box cars come to life. They have a dedicated room to  Mustangs. They even have chairs and couches that are 60s era.

This was a fantastic place to go if you love cars. Extremely friendly staff that make you feel welcome for sure. I think you can have parties there and that would be a very good and different option.  A must go.

name: Blackstone River State Park
address: Lower River Rd, Lincoln, RI 02865, USA
reviews: Wow.. such a nice state park.. peaceful and beautiful.. you can do cycling, running, etc..worth going there. Nice fall colors view. They have air pressure machine available in the park. I saw kayak boats also. It is just an hour drive from Burlington. So many close by stores available.
It's a really great Park if you want to go for a walk and be out in nature.
Enjoyable anytime of the year.  Great bike and walking path and the scenery is amazing.
Great place for jogging, cycling or brisk walk. It's calm place to enjoy nature's beauty. Be it fall colors or lush green trees.
Rode bikes on the trail & had a great time! There was a lot of beautiful scenery including a waterfall. Very tranquil and relaxing.

name: Los Andes
reviews: Came upon this charming restaurant by chance and apparently chance was on our side. The restaurant was super busy, which is always a good sign. The ambiance is very authentic and really nice. When we finally sat down and saw the menu, wow such great dishes to choose from. Loved the selection. The food was fantastic and the prices were shockingly inexpensive for the portions and high quality of the dishes. The employees are very friendly and helpful. Truly loved this restaurant and highly recommend it.

Everything from start to finish was absolutely stellar. The decor, the service, the atmosphere, everything was exactly as we had pictured it when we imagined a perfect romantic dinner for valentine's day. We started with the cocktail that was garnished with a grey goose infused strawberry dipped in chocolate, our potato based appetizer with the avocado puree and chicken was phenomenal as well. When our entrees came we were surprised at the amount of food they give you, the portions are large enough to take home for leftovers the next day. Everything we ordered tasted so wonderful and had such a beautiful balance. At one point the owner came to check on our table and he was so kind and personable. It is very clear he puts a lot of love into this restaurant, and we are ecstatic to return soon to try another delicious entree. Visiting Los Andes for dinner was the best decision we could have made for ourselves. If anyone is wondering if it's a good place to try and have never been, do it. You will not be disappointed.

Very good! Service was excellent attention to detail. Food was fresh and cooked perfectly. The taste was out of this world! Definitely a gem and a must try. Extremely busy so book ahead. One more thing the atmosphere was warm and inviting with a saltwater tank that separates the dining room and the bar as you walk in!

Amazing food!  Very authentic!  I travel the world as a crew member for an airline and this is some of the best food you will find. I ate there recently and asked about a certain spicy chili sauce I liked from Lima, Peru and the Owner took me to the kitchen and showed me how to make the sauce.   It just shows the passion for excellence and impeccable service they have.  Casually classy and never pretentious.  Do yourself a favor if you are ever in the Providence area, and try this place!  You should make reservations as it is often very busy.   Can’t wait to return when I am next in town!

We loved this often recommended restaurant. I had made us a late reservation for Valentine's Day but hoped if we arrived early, we might get a seat...no luck. But we did discover the back bar and there we found seats and the great service from Brittany. The apps, entries, drinks and dessert we're fantastic!

name: Gracie's
reviews:
One of our favorite places in pvdc. Excellent service, well thought out menu and innovative flavors. The only downside is the high level of noise and our inability (a table of three people) to hear each other without having to shout. 
Congratulations on the James Beard Award nominations! Well deserved.

We drove from Boston to Providence to try Gracie's during restaurant week( which they are extending all month) and we were not disappointed. 
Pulled up decided to valet, surprise! Valet is complimentary!
Once seated, the decor is tasteful and modern -- fine dining with a 2020 edge and a good wave of energy. 
The 3 course meal was $34.95 each and everything tasted wonderful. Tasty bread, carrot-ginger gazpacho, tender rich gnocchi, fresh beets straight from a local farm, a lemon-lime palate refresher before the main course and then crispy, but moist and fresh, flavorful swordfish.
All that followed by dessert that tasted and looked like they have a world-class baker in their kitchen. Did I mention that the cocktails were crafty -- a la bourbon sweet potato blended so smoothly? YES, a sweet potato bourbon cocktail.
All of that and 5-Star, but not snobby, courteous and timely service.  We enjoyed every moment and highly recommend this restaurant to EVERYONE reading this review.  We are foodies and go out every Wednesday to a different restaurant, so trust me, we know a good restaurant or two.
Go to Gracie's and enjoy yourself, on us. You're welcome!

Absolutely outstanding food, so many flavors. The staff was remarkable, attentive, and had plenty of knowledge of the food and menu. The atmosphere was exquisite. Very high end. I went during restaurant month and had a whole 3 course meal for under $40 and split it and was a decent amount of food. If you're ever in town check this place out 4 sure.

Great dining experience all in all. Service was truly impeccable- the cheese boards, wine and dessert were absolutely amazing- my one request is for the sweet potato entree that they add something like another veggie to accompany it- as I was a tad underwhelmed by the entree when I ordered it being that it was 25$ for a mere cut up sweet potato with some garnishes. My husband had the cod dish and it was incredible and very similar in price!

We went with a large group (10 people) and did the tasting menu with the wine pairing. It is not cheap and one of those outing you file under experience and not just dinner. The staff was very good and attentive and while the whole table did the tasting menu, the kitchen was able to accommodate multiple changes (no seafood, vegetarian, pescetarian). All used seasonal ingredients really well. Some dishes were better than others. No dish was an outright flop. The wine pairings were a little disappointing but that may depend on your palette. We had many wines that tended toward the sweet side. Overall, I'm glad I ate here and I'm glad a restaurant of this quality is thriving in Providence but that 7 course menu with wine is a steep cost with gratuity. Go for a very very special occasion but becoming a 'regular' would break my budget.

name: nicks on broadway
reviews: Food was amazing. We like to try new places and this was great.  The only things keeping us from going back would be the prices. Service was amazing.
Amazing Breakfast.   Really top notch restaurant.   Very busy and had to wait a while but worth it.  Highly recommended.

Food was good, restaurant is fairly small. Nice ambiance & we enjoyed being able to see the kitchen work. Not ideal for a large party and not the best for kids. We had to wait quite a while for a table for 4, seems best for parties of two.

First time going to Nicks on Broadway. Absolutely loved every part of it, the atmosphere when you walk in is dimly lit and modern with a chill vibe. The staff was very welcoming. We got a bottle of champagne (celebrating birthdays) that our server recommended which was nice. We decided to go with the chefs tasting menu, which is a 4 course meal left in the chefs hands to decide what he will be making for us. The menu changes based on what they can get for the freshest seafood, produce, and meats. They brought out "small bites" between some of the courses, and every course was amazing. The surprise made it fun also. My favorite course was chicken with fresh greens risotto and the house made foccacia was very good as well. Had some cool cocktails. We will be going back for the tasting menu again!

1st time here. Been trying forever to get here. What a mistake....... waiting so long. The food and service are amazing.  Don't bother ordering off the menu. Get the chef's tasting. 7 course if you can. Very nice atmosphere. You can actually talk and hear the other person you're with. Great place for a date night. We went on a Thursday 6pm. Very small place but got right in. Can't say enough good things about this place. Go see for yourself. I'd be amazed if you don't like it.

name: Cafe Nuovo
address: One Citizens Plaza, Providence, RI 02903, USA
reviews: Everything was great- somewhat difficult to find tucked away in the building, but well worth it. Helpful staff and waiter with great recommendations, and fun mixed drinks from the bar. Not a huge or complex menu but still sounds it difficult to choose. From appetizers to dessert, nothing disappointed.

The food was amazing.  It was a 5! Beautiful  place to take a date or even purpose... or just come and eat !
The deserts  are everything you could ask for.
Gives you a greater appreciation for Providence.

Cafe Nuovo is an absolute gem of providence cuisine! The staff is wonderful and attentive, the food is exquisite, and the wine selection is vast! I could not recommend a more wonderful dining experience. Over the past 4 years cafe nuovo has become a tradition for the wife and I when celebrating any event.

Overall an okay experience! When our waiter greeted us he went right into asking us about water options which we didn't hear him correctly on. Regular water would've been just fine, but we got charged $8 for still water that we didn't even touch. Refills are not free too, which we were surprised about. Other fine dining restaurants do have free refills. Once our food was placed in front our actual waiter never came around few min later to ask if everything was good/need anything else. We had to ask other servers to call over our server few times.

Have been to Cafe Nuovo several times in the past and everything has been consistently great.

The interior is very clean, comfortable, and upscale. 

The service in this establishment is fantastic and our server was always checking on us.

Started with a delicious bowl of their tomato soup. 
I had the filet mignon and mashed potatoes and the co reviewer had Spaetzle tenderloin.  Both meals were excellent!

First time I have ever had a "Potato Gaufrette"!

The co reviewer's Manhattans were also great and very "smooth".  She also claims this was the best cappuccino in Providence!

We both had dessert and do not regret the calories!  Creme brulee for me and the lemon cheesecake for the co reviewer. 

Definitely will be back!

name: Circe Restaurant & Bar - Providence
reviews: The food was delicious and there were a number of creative menu items in addition to traditional fare.  We had the deviled eggs and short ribs appetizers.  All very good. They have a good selection of wines and fun cocktails. A nice thing about the restaurant is that they are open for dinner earlier than most.  It is very popular - we were able to slip in without reservations at 4:30 but by 6:00 the place was packed.  The service was very prompt and the server knowledgeable about the menu items and the specials.

A large group of us came here after my best friend’s courthouse wedding, just down the street. It was close to the end of lunch service and the chef offered us the dinner menu in addition. The lunch menu looked amazing and everything was delicious—highly recommended the crab cakes.
We even got a complimentary champagne toast from the staff. We will never forget it!

What a gem in the financial district of Downtown Providence! I’ve passed by many times bu have never been in before. A college and I decided to try it out for lunch after reviewing the menu online. We both had a difficult time picking a lunch item everything sounded so good. I went with the meatloaf and my college had the Italian burger. The staff greeted us warmly when we arrived and the service was excellent. Our meals came out in a very reasonable amount of time looking delicious. Let’s just say by the time we were done the dishwasher didn’t have to work too hard. The place is very cool and very cozy. I liked that the kitchen is open to the dining area. We will definitely return and tell our friends and family.
Overall a good dining experience in Providence. It's got great food, really knowledgeable sommeliers! I highly recommend for family dinners, date night and work dinners.

The food was phenomenal. I tried a charcuterie board, short rib risotto balls, and the 2 way duck. All were great.

The special cocktail menu were also very well done. I recommend the Manhattan, which is sweeter than usual and the key lime pie martini from the dessert menu. I tried the busted nut, which was served in a coconut, but it was a bit watery tasting to me, likely from the coconut.

After 10pm, they had a DJ and a violinist, which was one of the coolest things I'd ever seen. He played violin to the music the DJ was playing.

They also serve food until midnight, which is a big deal around this area. They also have valet so you don't have to deal with finding parking.

name: The Capital Grille - Curbside Takeout & Delivery
address: 10 Memorial Blvd Ste 101, Providence, RI 02903, USA
reviews: Amazing food & service... Would have been 5 stars but for some reason even though the restaurant was mostly empty we we're sat in the back corner by the water station. My girlfriend and i were both dressed professionally...maybe it's just sop for early arrivals but it would have been nice to have a table with a view for our $200+ meal for two

Fabulous!! Calamari, Steak, chicken risotto, truffle fries, soy glazed Brussels (the BEST EVER!) and cheesecake to top it all off! Absolutely Amazing! Great location in downtown Providence on the river. Service was the best!, food was the best! We're definitely going to return in the summer to enjoy Capital Grille and downtown Providence! 👍

Overall this was a nice dining experience. A nice ambiance in the building which they took over after Ruth's Chris closed down.

The service is top notch. The waitress was more than attentive. The place looks nice and is laid out well. The menue was exotic and intriguing. I do recommend the place highly.

4 stars because my steak was overcooked and I didn't expect this since they put Ruth's Chris out of business but Ruth's never overcooked my steak. Still a great place to dine.
This place was awesome. Atmosphere was good. Food menu was good. Seating section was clean and comfortable.

Food was great. The guy serving us though was incredibly rude. It was very busy, so I can understand getting frustrated. But if you're paying $200+ for a meal, I do not think it's too much to ask to not be given an attitude. Will not be going back to this location

name: Camille's
reviews: Best dining experience I've had in the last few years. Food was delicious, servers were attentive and the restaurant was very nice. I will definitely be coming back.
Literally everything was amazing! Tony our waiter awesome! Sangria they have all the time and phenomenal!

Seafood was not that fresh.  Scallops were the size of a quarter and over cooked.  I had a Seafood dish that had one tough shrimp and one overcooked, quarter-sized scallop...See below.  Although the host or manager told me they were real, the potatoes tasted like instant.  The scallop dish was not much better.  For the expense, the food was not worth the money.  The best part of the meal was the wine.  The server let me taste 3, and the one I decided on was the best I've ever had.  The restaurant's ambiance is relaxing and beautiful.

Very Refined Dining experience, our server was like our personal Butler! The Food...simply to die for ! We (3) enjoyed apps, salads, dinners, desert and Coffee , not to mention Cocktails and a bottle of High End Wine. Every single item was without Fault! We celebrated like Kings in a Castle !!
Formal Italian restaurant with a variety of pastas and other plates. Very recommended for dates or special occasions.

name: Andino's Italian Restaurant
reviews: This place was amazing! The atmosphere, the food, and the service was a 10 all the way!! We had a great waiter named Phil who really made the experience a great and memorable one. The food was much better than I ever imagined starting with the stuffed mushroom caps!! Great lighting and  relaxing aura, Custom drinks too!! A++

Once again the best Italian food on the east coast!!! Plus last night we got take out and in a separate bag was a roll of toilet paper! At first I was surprised and kind of like what!!! But then after thinking I was grateful and amazed all in one,,,,, what a wired thing to find but a very nice thought!!! Thank you andinos ! Can’t wait to get to do sit down ASAP so I can tip mom 100 dollars we love her!!!!!

One of my favorites on the HILL! They have a gorgeous back patio with plants and shrubs and flowers. Great Frank Sinatra music. Food is amazing and the summer sangria selection and Martini selection is like nothing I've ever seen! If you're on the hill you need to make this a destination.

My wife and I have been to many restaurants in the past 20 years. Yesterday, we were fortunate that Andino was doing take out during these difficult times. We got the chicken parm and it was the best I have ever had. Usually, I would not eat a portion that large, but it was so good I could not help myself.  The bar and restaurant were beautiful. I got to meet the owner and he was extremely nice and he showed me the wonderful outdoor patio. He informed me he has a valet parking across the street. I cannot wait to take my family there often this summer. I am still thinking about the fantastic meal I had yesterday. Even though, five stars are the limit it deserves 10.
-James McMahon

THANK YOU ANDINOS! Much love for making my birthday extra special turning 60! 💜 My twin brother was smiling from heaven and most likely enjoyed your delicious food in his hay day before he died...he spent a lot of time on the Hill. Newport is my husband's and mine home away from home. Casual and fine dining BUT!...by far your restaurant,  it's ambiance, and YOUR FOOD surpasses them all! Thank you and Mary with all my heart! God bless and stay well! Love Ann Lancellotti 🙋‍♀️💜😘

name: Julian's
reviews: I was planning to go to Kitchen but it was unexpectedly closed... i was starving on such a chilly morning so I went to Julian’s. Oh my goodness! Julian’s is good in its own way! Love the Benedict! Love the super thick cut loaf! Look at the French toast!!! You can order half size. The dishes are BIG! The staff were super nice! And they served Rhode Island special drink coffee milk (though I did not like it...)!!! I will definitely back come only for Julian’s!

Breakfast galore! It was so busy on a Friday morning... we only waited 15 minutes or so. The portions are generous here and they have some unique things. We started off with bloody Mary’s which is a must!! It was quite delicious. I got the kimchi bowl which was a great Asian twist but still had the classics like eggs and potatoes. It was very hearty. We also shared half a French toast. That was good too. Love that they let you do half orders like of the Benedict.

Being from  northern Rhode Island I never knew this place existed. Glad I found it yesterday dining out with friends excellent eclectic foods volume up big portions! feel like you're in a familia hang out with people from all different ages and backgrounds. Would definitely go back there again.

Love that they serve brunch during the week! Food and drinks were delicious! Staff was attentive. I've heard good things but this was my first visit and it did not disappoint! Also, the bathroom is cool, I could spend forever looking at everything in there!

A must visit for brunch. Try to come after 1pm or 2pm to skip the line. 

The food was very creative with a ton of options and customizable plates. 

Beer geared more towards the sour beer elite with an acomodating list of options for mid grade craft beer lovers.

Awesome spot. Thank you!

name: CAV Restaurant
reviews: This was a very fine restaurant, great lighting and seating arrangements. The atmosphere was very unique. Great wine selection. I would say the food over all is an acquired taste. I tried something and it wasn't my cup of tea, but the management was so great I was able to get something else. Overall I highly recommend.

Went for brunch, great atmosphere,  excellent food and drinks. Service just a bit slow but nothing crazy. Also, need better table management,  there were several empty tables while we ate at the bar for over an hour, not a huge deal. Overall luv this place
An interesting restaurant with ambiance that feels like the comfort of sitting at home.. great service and delicious food too!
Nice ambience.  Interesting decor.  Friendly staff and great service.  Dishes were delicious.

The food and atmosphere was terrific! Everything was so great! My only quam was with the size of the croquettes appetizer. It was 5 teaspoon sized croquettes balls. This isn't reflective of any classic croquettes, which are much larger. They were so small that it had the typical affect portrayed in movies of over paying at a nice restaurant for a morsel of food. But our meals were delicious and so were the appetizers.

name: Enoteca Umberto
reviews: I’ve been waiting for a long time to go here. I called and talked to Umberto, he was very nice and got me scheduled to come in at 5 PM.  He opened the door greeted me like family and seared us.  All the food was amazing, and the winds were great.  It’s not going to dinner, it’s an experience. Umberto makes the night so special because of his amazing personality, warm & inviting. The girls cooking were so polite, his family came in later, little Italian adorable kids sitting behind the counter perfectly behaved.  Most of their food, and the wine  are all imported from different parts of Italy and Sicily.  It’s definitely an experience.  When you’re leaving, and the owner hugs  you just as tight as your own family, any questions?  Go here!

This place is truly authentic Italian! It's even more enjoyable if you understand the language and what's being said by Umberto and his wonderful family! Purely southern Italian cuisine combined with great wines makes for an unbeatable combination!

The single most overrated place I have EVER been. Besides it is a fraud. Wine overpriced. Owner fake. Worse than anything else, food not prepared on site....there is no oven, no cooktop. Food is REHEATED in toaster ovens and induction pans. Limited refrigeration. No fresh cooked items. I suspect food is prepared in another local restaurant and reheated. Food needs to be brought into the restaurant via the BATHROOM, can you believe it? STAY AWAY.

WOW! Just wow. This gem of an Italian restaurant can only fit ~10 people total at a time. You must have a reservation, but if you can get in-- you'll be welcomed with warm, open, Sicilian arms. The owners are an Italian couple who serve up a pre-fixe menu daily and what they've got is what you get (no menu otherwise). Amazing wine pairings from the same región as their family. Such a cozy place. A must try for anyone scoping out the Atwells/Italian scene.
Local favorite! Small restaurant with a warm feeling. Delicious food paired with imported boutique wines. Highly recommend!

name: RED FIN Crudo + Kitchen
reviews:
Great and easy food. Great staff. I can't remember the cocktail I had... The one with the lemon peel, but I would go back just for this cocktail.

Octopus was my favorite, the waiter also said that it's the restaurants most popular dish. He did not disappoint.

Vibe was calm and relaxing on a Wednesday night during the middle of March. Would definitely come back. 

Only bad aide is all the street parking was taken so we had to pay a heft parking fee in the parking garage.

I have an allergy to dairy and gluten which limits what I can eat.  One of the (few) gluten free options comes on a bed of cheese risotto.  I informed the waiter of my allergies and asked  if he could substitute the risotto for something else. He said "No, I'm sorry I can't." I asked if he had rice that I could just order on the side, along with my plate.  He said "No I'm sorry we can't do that." So I ordered the plate, and ate ONLY the meat. Such a waste of money.  After bringing out food, the waiter never even returned to our table to fill water or to check on us.  Luckily the adjacent waiters noticed our empty glasses and filled them up.  This is by far the worst service I've experienced in quite some time.  Red Fin, the world is increasingly becoming more restricted in terms of food intolerance.  If you can't substitute risotto for rice so that a patron can enjoy a plate, I kindly wish you well.  I can honestly say, this is the first time I've had someone draw a hard line at rice...(face palm).

Great first dinner spot in Providence. In a very walkable area and easy to get to. If you're a fan of seafood and/or tapas, I would recommend this place. The octopus, rissoto, and deviled eggs were great to have. The only downsides for this was the wait time to get a table and/or food, and the price is not really equitable to the amount of food you get. Overall, would visit again though.

Restaurant itself is very nice. It's a bit pricey but the quality of the meal that you get is very worthy. Service was excellent. Definitely would recommend and it's a place where you can go once in a while and spoil yourself.

The good parts: 
I got the pork Belly and my wife got the salad and deviled eggs. The pork belly was epic and I will get again. The salad's flavors were delicious. Mike, the bartender was fun to talk to and attentive but not just with us. He took care of everyone equally.
The bad parts:
The hostess was subpar. We had reservations and showed up 5 minutes early. There wasn't a table available. She offered the worst table to us next to the door even thought she was using as the host check in table.  The chairs were uncomfortable and they need to be replaced.

name: Mills Tavern
address: 101 N Main St, Providence, RI 02903, USA
reviews: We had a very nicely done halibut and salmon. Wood grilled smoky entrees seem to be their thing. Raw appetizer selection like oysters and clams. Friendly wait staff. Nice place to spend a couple hours. Not a bad walk from the state house.

The bartender was fabulous. Best whiskey sour ever. Dollar raw bar was fun. Then sat at a lovely table by the window and had a fantastic meal. Nick was our server. Always there when you needed something.

We were in the area visiting Brown and a friend told us about Mills Tavern. Very beautiful place. The food was amazing, we had the calamari(a different spin on it), ceviche was surprisingly delightful, oysters(some of the best I’ve had in a long time) and and the tomahawk wagyu(cooked to perfection) with mashed potatoes and asparagus. Service was great. Definitely will be back.

Excellent steakhouse offering expertly prepared seasonal cuisine. While steaks are the stars here, their lamb, venison, and swordfish are equal to the task. The raw bar is outstanding and as fresh as you'll find anywhere. The menu is seasonal and creative, the service top-notch.
Affogato .... for dessert.. and can I just say the mac n cheese is heavenly.... O yeah BEST LAMB CHOPS DOWNTOWN🐑

name: Siena
reviews: Quaint Italian place on the edge of Federal Hill. Great presentation, excellent service, and delicious food. They also had a complementary valet service for those struggling to find parking in federal hill (i.e. us!). The octopus and bread pudding were highlights. The only negative was that the price was slightly on the expensive side, so be prepared to spend quite a bit for what you are getting. Overall, would definitely visit again!

This is one of the finer Italian restaurants on Atwell. Great service, lots of laughs and wonderful meals.
A special night at a special place. Just how good things can be when you have great persons working for you.

Elegant feel and tasty food make this a worth-the-trip dining adventure. I enjoyed the pork chop with pear, and my friends raved over the risotto. The seasonal cocktails are not to be missed! I tasted my friend's "Fall for Figs" martini, and it was very nice, like an alcoholic Fig Newton, in the best way. Just go. Valet parking is available; we walked from the Hilton, and it was only 8 minutes at a leisurely stroll.

Kayla our server was awesome, dinner great, dessert not what we expected and to our surprise  management  compensated  us and  that my friend  showed us that Siena is a classy  restaurant.   and yes we will  try another dessert . This is definitely  a restaurant that we will go back to and you my friend should try it if you haven't  already

Went for restaurant week, great choice! I had the bruschetta, salmon and limoncello mousse. Everything was delicious. I loved the risotto that came with the salmon, it had a light lemon and mint flavor. I would recommend anyone to come here for dinner. Can't wait to go back and try more amazing food.

name: Massimo Ristorante
reviews:
Amazing food and desserts. If you're looking for an awesome Italian restaurant in Federal Hill this is the place to go. Make sure you get a reservation because it can get busy on the weekends. Love the bread they serve and the tomato dipping sauce.

Can't wait to go back.

Great food and lovely atmosphere. Our waitress made great recommendations for wine (we're usually not wine people, but it was wonderful) and dessert (the bread pudding was amazing). The entrees (Gnocchi & ravioli) were solid but probably weakest part of meal

Went to dinner with a colleague. Nice place with fantastic ambience. Food was nice and of good quality. Seafood is fresh and the service bu the waiter that served us was good as well. Definitely recommend this place.

One of the best meals I have ever had. The food is magnificent, cooked perfectly and the portions are generous. The atmosphere is very inviting and the staff outstanding. In particular, we had the extreme pleasure of  having Remi work with us and she is spectacular. Charming, sweet and extremely knowledgeable. She made a great evening perfect.

Friendly staff. I got the spaghetti with meatballs and sausage. The pasta was fresh and perfectly cooked. The meatballs were tender and flavorful. The sausage was somehow tough. Not just a little tough, but petrified. It was presumably cooked in the sauce. I would have thought it impossible to get Italian sausage to come out tough, cooked in this manner. They somehow pulled it off.

name: Providence Coal Fired Pizza
reviews: I was on a trip to Rhode Island, and this place was recommended to me. I don't like pizza with a crispy crust, so I didn't order pizza. However, many of my companions did and they enjoyed it. I ordered a meatball sub that was served with a cup of tomato soup. The soup was fantastic! It had little balls of mozzarella in there and basil on top and it was really tasty. My meatball sub was pretty good; it had lots of melted mozzarella, and it was nice and crispy, but the meatballs were a little dense. The service was really good, and we were able to get in and out during our 1 hour lunch.

Nice downtown location with plenty of street parking on the weekend. Pizza was good. Went here with my 4 kids and everyone was nice and satisfied when we left. 
Good pizza although a bit pricy.

We order a 2 small pizzas, the size of them were perfect for sharing between 2 people.

The pesto pizza was a bit disappointing, first of all it has a lot of oil in the pesto making the dough a bit soaky, and the chicken was totally without flavor.

By the way the Conrad pizza was really good, nice crunch on the dough and the sausage had a great flavor and a perfect combination with the onion and red pepper.

The price was a good deal with 10$ each pizza.
Will is a fantastic waiter! Rosemary wings & pizza was delicious as usual😊

Being from NYC, I am very picky with Pizza.  This was pretty good but not great.  I personally liked the Margherita more than the pepperoni.  Waiting time was long but the place was crowded so had to expect it.  The waiter at the bar provided good service.

name: Pane e Vino
reviews: This restaurant is amazing. I came here for my birthday. The place was packed because it was Valentine’s Day weekend, good thing we made reservations. The food and desserts were delicious such an amazing taste. The service was great and the FREE valet was a plus.  The place is a little small but the atmosphere is great. Will recommend this restaurant to anyone!!

Food and service is wonderful. My second time here. Lobster ravioli is my favorite but tonight I had the special, seafood pasta dish and it was very tasty with Neapolitan pasta, wine and tomato sauce coupled with shrimp and lobster need I say more! Completely mmmmmh worthy. My friend had the pork chops, I'm trying those next. The chops along with the fig is divine. The service is immaculate and the staff is very knowledgeable of the menu and sauces. I look forward to going again.

Great atmosphere and staff. Highly recommend. I walked past this place on Atwells quite often but finally I went in. Do not pass this place up! Great food and drinks. Watch the game at the bar, have a date at the tables, worth the visit for sure.

Extensive Gluten Free Menu 
Attentive Waitstaff 
They even have gluten free dinner rolls if you ask (they're the best i've ever had) Reminds me of Harry Potter inside. 
We order the specials. They never disappoint.
Place is great. Food is amazing and service is even better. Our server was the best!

name: Cassarino's Restaurant
reviews: Great menu. Excellent traditional Italian cuisine.  Outstanding table service. Our Server was John who did a great job and took very good care of us.  Valet out front.  Very nice wine selection. Love Cassarino's. Highly recommend. We'll be back.
Nice atmosphere, good food and reasonable prices. The customer service was good too. We would definitely go back to this restaurant again.
Delish!!  Great, cozy spot on Atwells. Authentic,  robust flavors. Nice wine list.  Knowledgeable server.  Got right in on a Tues eve but reservations recommended and can easily book online.

I hold Italian food on the hill to a certain standard, this was not up to my standards. The pink pesto sauce was just so over powered with pepper flavor, and the gnocchi were undercooked... my friends veal dish also didn’t impress me

Went here with a large group of people during a recent visit to Rhode Island and had a nice dinner.  We got some appetizer platters to share with the table and everything that was included was very tasty.  I then got the Cassarino and that was really good.  The portion size was huge and I was able to bring half of it home for lunch the next day.  This was a nice dinner in a nice setting on Federal Hill and I will definitely be back the next time I am in Rhode Island.

name: Providence Oyster Bar
reviews: If you want to have some amazing food this is the place! Make sure you come for happy hour Tuesday-Sunday 3-6:30, Monday 4-6:30  , $1 oyster and clams , $5 appetizers, with huge portions, the mussels, wings and clam chowder were absolutely delicious!!!!! And all off of happy hour menu , super cheap amazing quality food. The workers are nice, polite, quick and helpful. I want to come back now haha hopefully soon.

Phenomenal little restaurant in Providence's Little Italy district. The seafood is fresh and delicious while the staff is friendly and knowledgeable. I strongly recommend taking advantage of their bottomless mimosas/Bloody Mary as part of their brunch menu, they never leave you with an empty glass! Their desserts are also worth saving room for.

I had a fabulous dinner here with my boyfriend. Neither of us had been before, and we were so happy with every dish. The oysters Rockefeller and the scallop entree in particular were absolutely perfect. The service was on point, and the atmosphere was pleasant and bustling. I look forward to coming back!

Very nice restaurant.  I went on New Years and despite that they were short staffed our waitress did great, very attentive. 

The place was clean and good decor. 

The food was great! Absolutely delicious. I had the avocado toast with smoked salmon and it was amazing. They are also very accommodating. 

We went on New Years and therefore were able to park easily in the street. However, that area is very busy so parking can be challenging. 

I will definitely go back to this place again.
This restaurant was amazing!! I’m not from around here and I’m so glad I picked here to eat. The food was phenomenal and so was the music. I would 10/10 recommend!

name: The Grange
reviews: Excellent customer service. Really diverse menu options and especially for gluten-free and plant-based. The aesthetics were beautiful it’s a really great place to have ambience and a casual atmosphere.

We had a good time at the Grange. The service was a little bit slow but very nice and helpful. I got scrambled tofu with mushrooms and vegan cheese and I loved it a lot. My husband had biscuits n gravy and was not impressed (it sounded much better than tasted). He recommends it only to those who really love mushrooms. 
Very uncomfortable chairs 🤷🏻‍♀️
Love the vibes. Rustic design with tropical greens. Perfect setup. Food is awesome. Great vegan or vegetarian choices.  Friendly service.

Great atmosphere, layout and design. I am not began, so the menu did not appeal to me as much as other places. However, it's a great place for coffee or a drink. The staff are friendly and accommodating.

Absolutely the best restaurant in Providence, amazing food my meat eating friends don't even mind coming here. The food never feels lacking it's incredibly creative and we'll put together. The drinks are super creative and absolutely delicious.

name: Al Forno Restaurant
address: 577 S Water St, Providence, RI 02903, USA
reviews: Our first time here and we can't wait to come back! Service was swift and sweet! We shared everything and thank goodness because portions were plentiful!

Nice atmosphere and good service, but the food left a lot to be desired. I rarely leave reviews but this place was extremely disappointing. Pizza was so bad to be barely edible. Dessert was good but did not make up for the terrible and way overpriced appetizers and entrees. With so many wonderful restaurants in Providence, I would strongly advise going elsewhere.

Perhaps it was because we were sitting with the owner last night, but judging by what other people say, I don't think so. This food was great. The quality is exceptional. 

The margherita pizza is possibly the best I've ever had, and it's different than any one I've ever had before. We ended up with several things at our table, lamb, the duck pasta, short ribs, the octopus salad, mashed potatoes, Romanesco, Caesar salad... It was all delicious. 

I'm not much of a dessert person, but the desserts were fantastic. I like that you order your dessert when you order your main course because the desserts are cooked to order. The cookies are baked to order. Everything is done for you that night when you order. Fantastic. Yeah.

I went here by myself and I must say I was very pleased. I sat at the bar upstairs and made friends with other travelers. 
The food was amazing.  I also tried their grilled pizza and I was impressed with how thin the crust was.  Highly recommend.  And Kyle the bartender was very professional and prompt with serving.

We love Al Forno. We had our wedding reception there 17 years ago, and it has just got better with time. We return every year for our anniversary celebration. The wine list is phenomenal, the food is the best in the state, and the service is immaculate. Don't forget to order your dessert when you order your entree. Enjoy!

name: East Side Pockets
reviews: I stopped in here for dinner on a Saturday evening while visiting Providence. It was around 6:30pm and parking in the area was really hard to find. We ended up parking a few streets over and walked over. The place was very busy but they went through the line quickly. I got the gyro and chicken wrap with all the toppings and it was very good. The amount of meat I got for the price was impressive and it was all well cooked and seasoned. There is some seating inside but it seems that most take their food to go. I'd definitely recommend trying out this place.
One of the best falafel places around Providence and Boston area! It more of a take out place than a sit down place. Owner and staffs are very friendly!

We've been eating at East Side Pockets for years. The food is delicious.  You know it's really good when you always see a line in there. The place is small with some tables and benches inside, plus in the nice weather you can sit outside. Definitely a highly recommended place.

Love the Place overall but tried it yesterday (4/10/20) and was extremely disappointed. Portion size twice as small as it used to be ( I get that it’s not easy times but at least they have to set expectations).  For example, all the places I tried in the past couple of weeks make as big portions if not bigger. FYI I’m trying to support local businesses
Good choice for Vegans! Thanks for the Valentines’s day special heart falafel.  Try the homemade Sweets.

name: Luxe Burger Bar
reviews: I absolutely love this place. Where else on earth Can you create your own burger with so many options? I prefer The grilled cheese bun every time I go there with different variations of my favorite burger. The loaded fries are awesome. Staff is always friendly.

The food was delicious, but the service was slow with a very short staff team. Expect this if you go there on weeknights. Good ambiance with low level lighting, great for a low-key meal or date. Their vegan/veggie burger is pretty good, and their Build Your Own Burger menu has many options.

Let's get one thing clear: the food is great. The main draw of this burger bar is the build your own burger option. Opening the menu, you're welcomed with option after option of buns, meats, toppings and sauces. A plethora of drinks are available including milkshakes and draft beers. The burger I got was full of flavor, well cooked and delicious. I'll be coming back here soon.

First time here and we loved it!! The burgers ate absolutely amazingly good!! Not cheap but not expensive either for luxury burgers. Server was really good to us and very knowledgeable about the menu.

I can't post a review without giving at least 1 star. I give none. The restaurant was empty except for 3 people. Seating was still an issue for me and my 6' 7" friend. 25 minute wait for food. Burger smelled like moldy rag. Then waited 25 additional minutes for the milkshake that was ordered. Was served 5 oz in a to go cup. Questioned what would appear to be the manager, with his air of importance, about the portion size. No response but a contemptuous look. Very capable young lady removed the milk(shake) from the bill and apologized.To that young lady: you did well and I am sorry you didn't receive the tip that I left. I will however leave you one here. Find another job, you are smarter than your supervisor and deserve better than to be subject to an incompetent...

name: Harry's Bar & Burger
address: 121 N Main St, Providence, RI 02903, USA
reviews:
Ask for what they have on draft, there’s always more.

We were shocked at the pricing, for PVD we expected far more for an artisan style burger place. Beers were great, atmosphere was fine.

We weren’t into the onion things, too mushy but you HAVE to order the cauliflower bites, there was amazing. We ordered the the pulled pork and pastrami sliders, we wanted to try them all honestly.

We liked the place so much (and that they had old speckled hen on tap) we came back twice in one day!
As always did not disappoint, great selection of beer and food. Love the salt and pepper fries
Very good craft beers. The burgers (served by two -or three-) were very tasty. Not expensive.
Fabulous meal... Burgers with cheese bacon onion rings etc. Sweat potatoes, classic ones. Beer, cider. And half price from 3 to 5PM. Nothing to add.

I LOVE THIS PLACE. Their drinks, and staff, and burgers and fries are so amazing and addicting. I love their alcoholic s'mores milkshake and the bartenders are usually great. Good place to go alone or with a group of people, very shareable plates. I'm just drooling thinking about it now.

name: Vinya Test Kitchen
reviews: Very small intimate place with excellent food and service.  The pictures say it all in regard to the food. The owner of the restaurant takes care of the customers with undivided attention.  You will be happy with this place if you are looking for inspired original creations.

My boyfriend and I just experienced the 6 course meal tonight and it was a treat! I loved the experience and everything tasted great! Owner has great communication! And we loved how it was all family working together.

We called ahead on a Saturday night for a 4 course tasting menu. The restaurant is very intimate where one can see the chefs at work. The food was excellent: the high points of our meal was mahi mahi first course that was incredibly tender and a scallops main course which was cooked perfectly. The price we paid was 60 for the 4 course meal. 

There is a wine shop next door, but you can bring any wine or booze you like.
Should have a line out the door. Byob, affordable high-end food. Been 3 times, and all plates gave been great. A must try.
Amazing food with an intimate ambiance

name: Joe Marzilli's Old Canteen Italian Restaurant
reviews: Very reasonably priced for lunch. We enjoyed the lunch special which comes with soup and jello or ice cream. Chicken parm was of good quality. Valet parking is a nice touch in the area. Family friendly and very busy for an early lunch on a Saturday

Fantastic food! We went on a weekend (I would highly recommend a reservation unless you are eating at 3pm) and were pleasantly surprised. Real Italian food served in a way that makes you feel like you're at grandmas. They offer a 4 course meal for $2 extra on your entree - bread, salad or soup, your chosen entree, and ice cream or jello. This is the kind of restaurant I remember going to as a kid (I'm only 23) and I wish more places were still like this. I got the veal piccata and oh my I wanted to swim in that lemon butter sauce.

The best of the best in Providence’s Federal Hill.. Italian to a tee. The best sauce, bread, spumoni, soup.  You can have a 7 course meal starting at $20. And up..
The setting is elegant, though you can bring a family.. Pink is the color with elegant cloths and napkins.. Staff is professionally dressed and been there forever .. Valet parking.. Reservations suggested on weekends.. Fine to walk in before 5. One of the oldest restaurants on the Hill.

One of the most exclusive, classiest & exquisite Italian restaurants available in New England.

Chef Peter is an amazing & a gifted chef. Greeted by class-act maitre d’  David & treated w/ attentive grace. I have dined in places all over the United States.. Waiter: Jay is simply one of the best.. extensive knowledge of the menu, refined & classy. 

A restaurant of Excellence -my highest recommendation - indeed!
Fantastic service and wonderful food. Had a great time.

name: north
reviews: I've been dying to go to this place for a while and we finally did. Some dishes were great like the fried fish over mint rice and the ceviche others not so much. They change the menu offer so I would go back and see if we get luckier but for this specific experience we weren't impressed.
Unreal dining experience. Flavors were off the charts. Hot Sesame Noodles and Cocoa Coconut Creme stole the show. Can’t wait to make it back to try more!

Super Ramen Sunday Review: $20 for a bowl and a drink (selected from fixed menu of Paloma, beer, wine). Wife got the rose which was deliciously funky in the best way. We ordered the lamb and pork belly ramen bowls. Both broths had a great texture - rich and almost velvety. The noodles (I believe made in house) had that nice chew. As a whole, both bowls were short of being really good. Missing some depth and maybe some spice. The lamb bowl had a mixture of mint that worked well, but the pork bowl missed something similar. The atmosphere was nice and would return to try out items from the regular menu. Heads up, the small space filled up in almost 20 minutes after opening on a Sunday evening.
Best restaurant in town. Menu changes w the season. All the staff genuinely care about making the experience lovely. Y'all never wanna leave. Esp! After having The Tiny Ham Biscuits❤💛😊

Great food, drinks, and atmosphere. I had the mackerel special and the ramen. The mackerel was delicious. The citrus cabbage slaw really complements the strong flavor of the mackerel. The ramen for this month was a vegetable ramen.  The texture of the ramen was perfect. I like that the broth wasn't overly salty. Overall, a good dish. The cocktail was also great.

name: Bucktown
address: 471 W Fountain St, Providence, RI 02903, USA
reviews: Our kind of comfort foods. Great place that serves classic southern foods. Tasty fried chicken with various side dishes you're gonna love. Good price as well. Very recommended.

Went there for the first time today and I wish I could give this place 5 stars...but I can't. I went with my daughters. One had the chicken biscuit and Mac and cheese and she liked it. My other daughter had egg and cheese sandwich with waffle fries she liked it. I had the chicken and waffles.... waffle was good. The coating on the chicken..very tasty..but unfortunately my chicken wasn't cooked all the way through. I was so disappointed. I wanted to eat but couldn't. Ended up taking one of the pieces to finish cooking it at home. The coleslaw had too much vinegar in it for my liking. I heard so many good things but unfortunately my visit wasn't that great. I don't know if I will try this place again.

Amazing food. Got the fried chicken dinner with potato salad and creamy slaw.  Chicken was fried perfectly. Juicy, crunchy, the breading had a great flavor. The potato salad was different than the types I usually have which are mayo based. These were more mustard based and delicious. Slaw was perfect. Will be going back for sure.

Being born and raised in South Carolina I have definitely had my fair share of southern food, Bucktown definitely nails that classic southern food momma cooked feel and taste. From the first bite of the collard green to the last bite of the chicken biscuits. It has truly been the most enjoyable food experience I've had in the last 7 years while traveling the United States.

Bucktown is absolutely the best example of not judging someone by their size. The flavors and quality are miles above any fried chicken place I've been across the country. So if you step in the door and are scared by how small the place is, be brave, pull up a chair, and make a new friend with the best food in Providence.

name: Bluefin Grille
reviews: Excellent food and service. What really impressed me was that they have several gluten free options, and they also accommodated my dairy free as well. A lot of their food is also locally sourced so that makes me more likely to return.  Overall, delicious food and great experience.
Food was excellent! Service was fantastic! And the crab and asparagus ravioli was the best I ever had. Perfect honeymoon dinner!!!
Went with my daughter on New Year's Day for the buffet and it was decent. Service was really good. Food was fair.

Marriott Downtown's restaurant - very lively and popular place, great food. Got dinner here as well as breakfast - and I highly recommend the breakfast! The spread was awesome, the food was fresh, and we particularly enjoyed the live cooking of omelettes. Touche!
Very good pritty quick ccx and good hospitality

name: Fleming’s Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar
address: The Residences Providence, 1 W Exchange St, Providence, RI 02903, USA
reviews: Celebrated our 33rd wedding anniversary here.  My husband let them know when he made the reservation, and the staff took fantastic care of us.  The table was a generous booth meant for four, decorated with sparkly disks and sported a card signed by the staff.  Terrific food: we shared the 35 ounce steak, and at our request sliced it for us in the kitchen.  The roasted carrots were delicious, as were the asparagus.  I love that the menu gave the calories for most of the dishes.  Staff was attentive and friendly, but not intrusive.  They decanted the wine before we asked.  I would like for the after dinner drink menu to have the prices.  Would love to return sometime.

This was my first time dining here and it was delicious. Everything was perfect! Had a reservation and seated right away. Waitress came right over and took drink order and delivered promptly. The other waitstaff was on- top of it all. They made sure water glasses were always filled and to be cleaned dishes taken off the table. Steak was cooked to perfection and seasoned just right. We will definitely be dining here again.

This place was pretty delicious I won't lie but I've definitely had better service, food was pretty good they definitely spoiled us for a little bit but the warm welcome wore thin. I wasn't really dressed to code wearing a union t-shirt and camouflage but damn was a good patron. In conclusion I would say the corn has the most oniony flavor I've ever tasted in my life. Order at least three things of espresso because the third one will be double-filled 😉

Great wine and ports available. Nice dining room and service, but I've actually had better steak at Ruth's Chris. Nothing on the menu is worth the price they charge. The food was good and it was a nice evening though.

One of taste good restaurant in Providence. Rib eye  steak 🥩 was delicious.  price is $$$$ but not super crazy price than NYC. They have special price for weekday so you can try. Check the photo what menu pics.

name: Rosmarin
reviews:
the food is absolutely awe-inspiring...every bite brings you several waves of experiences.. while each one is distinct, the combination is surprisingly perfect. true craftmanship...

Very charming and intimate store run by a father and son
Some creative and delicious dishes. We did the six-course tasting and each dish was very good.
Great table services. Fast services by great staff. Everything was well organised. Staff were nice and greeted us very well.

Best quality of ingredients and perfect selection of food choices when you choose the tasting menu. 

Spectacular food presentation reminds me of a New York restaurant in RI.
Amazing place. Food was excellent. great services.

name: Oberlin
reviews: Welcoming, chill atmosphere. I only stepped in because I had a sweet tooth and ended up having a great apple tart with a pretty delicate geranium ice cream. The ladies working let me taste some sherries and even recommended some other places to see and eat while I'm in town.
The one is $16.00, and literally one bite. The food quality is great, but the portion is absurdly small. You will starve even after spending $160.00 on the entrees to buy 10 of this to eat.

This placed earned every one of those stars.  Atmosphere is A+, service is A+, and I drove down from Boston and can safely say the food is better than anything I've there.  The raw Fluke was amazing. Gnocchi was perfect texture and flavor, the squid and carrots were spectacular.  This place should be top of your list.

One of, if not the best spot to sample FRESH, local seafood in a laidback setting. Contemporary plates are art to the eyes, and to the palette. The wine list is absolutely top notch. The great staff will walk you through your odyssey.
Unique menu. Ask to sample the sake selection.

name: Tallulah's Taqueria
reviews: Not bad flavor, but they need to get better at managing expectations. Understanding there is shut down. Don't set pick up times and not stick to it or be so far behind it's over an hour waiting on line. Also set a tone for social distancing. This is a hot mess and looks like an issue waiting to happen. No one following any rules.

Love this place their burritos and tacos are amazing and so are the margaritas do not forget to try one of those! Can’t wait until I can go back to dining in and not just take out thank you for doing such a great job especially during the pandemic much appreciated!

This food is pheNOMenal! So good you'll want to eat it fast -- But slow down and enjoy the meal. Several great meats to choose from, an amazing selection of added veggies and condiments come standard, fair prices and excellent service. Small building, big flavor!

We did a quick search online for tacos. This place came up amongst many other options. We read the reviews and realized quickly we needed to check this place out.

 As soon as we walked in the door we were warmly greeted to a nice clean Indoor "taco stand". (they have way more than tacos) 

The person behind the counter was extremely friendly, helpful and led us on our Mexican Journey. We each got three different tacos, fresh salsa, chips, guacamole and local soda. The prices were perfect considering the quality and quantity. 

We grabbed seats in their outdoor seating area. And within a few minutes the friendly staff brought our plate out. I was expecting tacos to be wrapped up and throw  in the bag, yet I was extremely excited to see their presentation. The tacos look like a work of art on the plate. 

Each Taco had a unique taste and was topped with amazingly fresh cilantro. From the first bite to the last bite we enjoyed every morsel of Mexican goodness that was on our plate. 

We will be back for sure to check out every other item on their menu. It is worth the drive from Fall River!
The best Mexican Restaurant in RI. I love this place a lot. You can order anything in their menu and its so delicious and mouth watering.

name: Capriccio
reviews: Went during providence restaurant week, and had a great experience! Really strong options and everyone was quite happy with their meals. Would definitely recommend and go there again

Truly a 5 star dining experience! The best restaurant i have been to in my 35 years alive. Elegant and romantic. Will he back for every occasion possible. Beef Wellington was melt in your mouth. Worth every dollar spent

Had a dinner there with my wife. Both loved it. Food, service, environment. Was not many people there at that time, food was coming out on perfect timing. Prices are reasonable. You want cheap, go to olive garden. Will definitely recommend this place.

The staff was very attentive and friendly , very detailed in requests. The food was better than expected, the presentation was beautiful and the food was smooth and flavorful. Compliments to the chef, the waiters, and all other participating staff. We will be returning! 
Food 10/10.      Staff 10/10.      Ambience 9/10 

10/10 Recommend

It's more flash than substance. The decor, the service (such as a plate that is only intended to hold a napkin), the prices, and it's reputation make you think you're in for something special. Are you? Yes and no. As I said, the service from multiple people makes you feel like a VIP, my veal was perfectly cooked with a delicious sauce (but not everyone was happy with their dishes) but everything takes absolutely forever. Longer than in Europe. It was 45 minutes before the appetizers came out. The entrees ordered at the same time arrived about an hour after that. They weren't terribly busy, a lot of people were working, most of the dishes ordered weren't that complicated. The waiter had quite a personality so that's a plus. But this is really the place to take people you want to impress, esp. those who value price tags over food quality. I mean, the food is pretty good, but if you've been to a lot of top notch places already, you'll notice the overall quality doesn't quite match the price tag

name: Trattoria Zooma
reviews: Great atmosphere.  Beautiful  furnishings. Attentive staff. Located on the heart of Federal Hill this place has it all.  Perfect place for an upscale evening. Have a dish prepared with the homemade pasta.  Seriously good. Squid ink pasta with shrimp in lemon garlic butter was delightful fresh bright and piping hot. Definitely coming back.

It was a very nice place to visit. Friendly staff and nice comfortable environment. The food was terrific and the valet was easy and convenient, very appreciative of it. A little expensive but for what you get it's 100% worth it. If fine Italian cuisine is your thing, then I'd definitely reccomend going here.

I had never stopped into Zooma before and was pleasantly surprised. The service was great in a really nice setting. My dinner was not great but it was good. Everyone at my table loved their meal,mine wasgood. I will definitely return.

I had previously overlooked this spot in favor of other Italian options.  Sorely regret that. This might be my new fave. Hands down best pasta I have ever had.  Service was spectacular. We will absolutely be back.

I visited when I was super hungry and then when the plate arrived to my table... the plate was big, bigger than the ones you're used to. The portion, the smell, the taste - everything about the pasta and soup and salad superb! 

I'll be visiting again.

name: Chez Pascal & The Wurst Kitchen
reviews: Whenever we drive up to Boston we try to stop here. Both sides of the Alsace-Lorraine themed restaurant are fantastic. Stop by the Wurst Kitchen at lunch for some tasty German sausage. Or sup at Chez Pascal's fine French dining room with great wine pairings in the evenings - both options are fresh, pleasant, and delctable!
Absolutely delicious! I have been here few times and every single time I very well satisfied with the food and desserts. The staff is very friendly and the place is cozy.

Have only been once but I can definitely say that the dog & sauerkraut I had there is memorable. Traditional yet funky sauerkraut, some of the best I have ever had. I look forward to visiting again in the future.

At first sight it seems an odd combination; French cuisine with a Wurst kitchen. However, a selection of sausages makes a great starter to share. Then we moved onto the French dishes for the entrees. None in the group had anything but praise for the entire meal. With friendly service, this definitely a restaurant on the list for a return visit.

This place is quaint and so charming.  Every time we've gotten the mussels we've been happy!  Their pickled cucumbers are so deliciously tangy- we wanted more and next time we will ask for a side of them!  The waitress did not check on us much so we never got a chance to ask for more.  They  are offering a variety of jams, including bacon jam that we thought would make great Christmas presents- so we'll be back.

name: The Dorrance
reviews: Great service 🙌 great vibe with live jazz in this beautiful old bank building! The food is delicious! I have been into few places that has food this good! Great job to the Chef 👨‍🍳 I will definitely be coming back here many more times!

Just amazing food. A bit pricey (but it’s reasonable if you consider the atmosphere and attention the waitstaff gives you) 
I have gone here before and split a meal between two of us and the baby and they never once acted like we were weird for that. Never classist or snobby. Just a great beautiful restaurant with the best American food and staff. Worth it just to sit inside that gorgeous building in the afternoon.

Wedding reception here. Was absolutely awesome. The atmosphere is picture perfect, food was great, and bartenders were really good. It was a bit warm (I think because the building is older) other than that I highly suggest it. Great service.
Awesome place and the food was great. We went on a live jazz night and had a great time!!

I've been here a couple of time for drinks but tonight we had dinner as well.  The drinks are fun and very tasty.  There was live music without a cover and the ambiance is great.  The building itself is absolutely gorgeous,  the bank-turned-restsurant is great.  Original ceilings, stained glass windows, and bank vault lounge in the back are super cool.  The chef is excellent and the staff are amazing!!!! 100% recommend for drinks or dinner or both.

name: Federal Taphouse & Kitchen
reviews: I came here on a Saturday afternoon for some lunch and drinks with friends. We were able to find parking a few streets down and walked over to the restaurant. The inside was pretty busy, they do brunch on Saturdays with bottomless mimosas or bloody Mary's so I could see why they'd be so popular. The waitress Dawn was so friendly and great, she checked in on us a few times and made sure the food was good. The 1/4 chicken was nice and moist and the peas with bacon were a good side. I also thought the prices were really reasonable considering the amount of food. I'd recommend a visit in.

One of my favorite places to visit! The food and drinks are always good. Best atmosphere and the bartenders are always super friendly. Kellie is always so friendly and makes the best drinks. Always making everyone that walks in feeling welcome!

AMAZING! Great drinks and super delicious food!! They have a gluten free menu upon request. I ordered the gluten free nachos with shredded chicken and gluten free chicken wings. The nachos were loaded with toppings and large enough to share. The chicken wings came with 2 dipping sauces. Both were AMAZING!! Fun spot.

My wife and I shared the most amazing app of clams casino,  then we shared a pitcher of their white sangria which was a little drier than I expected but was still refreshing and it was actually quite good. For dinner I had the half chicken with 2 sauces and 2 sides. I was disappointed when it came to the table because I had asked for double pan gravy and they sent a gravy boat with a very nice pan gravy but the other one was a zesty BBQ sauce, which may have been a great sauce in its own right but when you expect one thing and get another it does ruin the experience a bit. The chicken was a little dry as well but did taste quite good especially with the pan gravy.

Visited on a Wednesday for "Steak & Wine" night. Wasn't busy. Went for my birthday dinner with 2 adults and one child, so it is kind friendly, but does not have a kid's menu. I ordered the steak and it was cooked the way I like it. Had a Sangria which was pretty good. Will visit again.

name: Persimmon
reviews: My favorite restaurant in Providence. Staff is always so accommodating and makes great recommendations. My friend and I usually share about 5 courses and they never complain if we decide to add another one on mid meal. The food is absolutely amazing. I've never had a bad meal here. Thank you!

I had heard so much about Persimmon, I was very excited to have brunch here with some friends. We were not disappointed. From the minute we walked in to the dining room, we were treated so well. The menu was sophisticated and the presentation so high end. Flavors were spectacular.

I enjoyed my time here. I had a great seasonal cocktail and the food generally was great! Some dishes I liked more than others, and definitely be prepared to order more than 1 thing. This is the type of place where you’ll have a culinary experience, so be prepared to spend a bit more to feel satisfied. It was a great date night place!

Wow. This is a truly special place. Each dish tonight was unique, complex, and beautifully balanced. Persimmon consistently rivals what I consider the best of the best. The Venison Wellington was just sublime!
Cool place good food. Slow on new years eve but that is understandable.

name: Andreas
reviews: Wonderful Greek food close to Brown! Great service and delicious dishes, I recommend it to anyone who loves authentic Greek food.

Always enjoy Andreas. Prices have risen but food quality still great. Prep and service were excellent as usual. Quiet when I arrived but soon picked up but no one seemed rattled, customers or staff. No real complaints. Four stars because I hope they continue to strive for greatness  Next time happy to go one higher!

My companion and I are not fond of Greek food, but we were looking for breakfast and they have a large breakfast menu. I had the eggs Benadict and she had the stuffed french toast. Both were good, but nothing exceptional. Service was quick and friendly and the price was reasonable.
Great location. Great food. Excellent and attentive staff. Owner is a real cool guy. Atmosphere is very fancy like. Nice spot for sure to check out on Thayer
Tasty dishes with fast friendly service.  This place is super convenient for a pre Brown hockey game meal.

name: Rosalina
reviews: Simple menu with a spin on traditional favorites. The atmosphere is cozy and the servers are knowledgable. Overall better experience than i expected. The pork chop was amazing. I will definitely go back. The prices are very reasonable for a downtown location.

The atmosphere is Lovely and our Hostess and Server were great however my beautiful meal was served ice cold..I had the Ravioli with Meatballs - My Husband and Daughters meal was nice and hot so they were happy...I normally don't return food I just don't go back but my daughter encouraged me to ask for a new plate. Our server gave us a dessert to share with a heartfelt apology...for me I don't think I will return. The Chef that prepared the food for our table had to know they were serving a plate that was not heated...

Get the meatballs, get the pasta with pomodoro, get the chicken parm, get the bread and riccotta served with olive oil. Does it seem like I ordered too much? never! Cause these guys do it right and the atmosphere is really cool here. Best seat for me is the bar, great service and views of the kitchen.
Great food and service! Best polenta I’ve ever had-period! Thanks, Will, for friendly and attentive service. Probably our new go to spot for my wife and me.

We can’t speak highly enough of Rosalina. Having them cater our wedding made all the difference in the world. Lauren was absolutely wonderful. She managed to make our special day that much more amazing thanks to a wonderful selection of foods and outstanding service. We recommend Rosalina to everyone we meet. Thank you, Lauren, Tom, and team!

name: The Slow Rhode
address: 425 W Fountain St, Providence, RI 02903, USA
reviews: I had dinner and drinks with three friends at Slow Rhode this weekend and it was an awesome experience.   We tried lots of different things and  every dish was great.   The menu may be a little limited but everything on the menu is delicious.   Plus,  it was only $55 per person with a  tip that showed appreciation for the great service. You should absolutely check it out!

Good flavors, good drinks.  The menu had a lot going for it and the chef doesn't hold back on spice especially with the hot fried chicken. My only complaint was that the dishes sometimes felt like mugs of great flavor that just didn't blend flawlessly together

Seems like a neighborhood hangout. Tucked into a building with about 4 places and a pretty small sign that has a S and R on it next to large parking lot. Has a bar with about 10 seats and then a row of tables with seating for about 20. Simple and small menu. $10 cocktails to choose from. Ordered the burgers which were good sized and had good flavor, the sweet onions seemed to be on the salty side. Fries were tasty as well. Food took awhile to come to the table. So definitely better of a place to sit and drink and hangout for awhile instead of a quick dinner. Not necessarily a place to take the kids, no highchair available.
Nice people and good spot for a drink. Menu is limited so dinner might not have lots of variety. Outdoor seating in the summer. Parking lot.

I did a google search and found this restaurant. Had the fish fillet sandwich and it was great! My sister got the duck drum sticks and she was licking her fingers afterward. I did take out but went to the restaurant to check the place out. It is small but very fashionable. Lived in NYC for 20 yrs. and it reminds me of the kinda place I would see downtown. Very much worth the trip to this place. 👍🏽

name: Yoleni’s Providence
reviews: we love this place - the food here is delicious!  we ordered take-out during this stay-at-home order over the phone. it was easy, tasty, and everyone was friendly. recommend!

Went there with my Greek best friend for a quick lunch. The food was decent and had live jazz music playing too. Liked the environment. And my best friend said the food is really good, even though not 100% authentic. Would go there again.

The yogurt bar is amazing. The restaurant is hit and miss, as some of the meat entrees were obviously reheated. The grocery area is fun to browse through because they import foods that you can't find anywhere else.

Yoleni`s is ethnic Greek restaurant and Bar. It is based in historical building where once diamond and Jewelry auction used to be  held. The place serves ethnic Greek food. Different type of dry fruits.Great staff Great service visible from road .
The vegan sandwich was delicious. The latte came out piping hot which is the way I like it. I also like the airy open space of the dining room.  The music is a little loud though, but tolerable.

name: The East End
reviews: Very small and cozy place,  has that rustic appeal inside and out . The bar, well it's out of this world with it's selection of spirits. Particularly their whiskey/bourbon selections.  You will find just about anything a whiskey collector has or is dying to aquire in here.  If you are looking to sample a dram of pappy Van Winkle 23 yr or maybe something even more sought after to you personally, this is where you find it. You will pay for it in the form of a dram ( 3/4oz) or a pour (2oz) . Water droppers are offered with your pour.  Prices are ok and parking is limited to the street. So if you want to just taste something your trying to track down , or celebrating and want something fancy , this is the spot to find it.

The menu is constantly being updated so it makes you want to keep going back so you won't miss a single thing. Every thing I've ordered has been outrageously delicious. Just classic dishes made with good ingredients like a spicy chicken sandwich or a burger and fries but it's elevated to something gourmet and gorgeous. Also they have a huge whiskey selection and some fantastic cocktails. It's very dark in here and it fills up fast so get in there while you can
Drinks were excellent, atmosphere was excellent, food was fantastic. What more could you ask for. Great place to hang out with friends or take a date.
Classy and cozy place! A friend said it's a good place to go on a date! Right on Wickeden near the point street bridge so you can walk over to the hot club or whiskey republic later in the night!
Absolutely fantastic atmosphere. I only came here to try the fantastic Bourbons they have, but will definitely be back to get the whole experience.

name: Angelo's Restaurant
reviews: What's not to love on Federal Hill! We stopped in for lunch on a Tuesday afternoon, we were seated immediately. We used the rear valet entrance. If you know the area the parking lot is behind the restaurant. I had a chicken parmigiana sandwich, the others had a cheese ravioli plate & veal w/peppers & fried calamari. No complaints on quality of the food. However here's what I wasn't a fan of, the portions especially the veal! Definitely not enough for my husband! This also wasn't offered w/any sides other than the bread that was brought to the table. The calamari wasn't enough for 2 people to split & I ate the entire portion, was really delicious!! I wish they would have offered fries or a salad or even a pickle w/my sandwich. The staff was friendly. The interior is decorated w/photos of years ago, a train on track will travel if you insert a coin.  I would return but I truly expected much more from a Federal Hill restaurant.

I originally wanted to go to the Wise Guys, but they don't open till 3pm so I went next door. After all this is Federal Hill and any place here should be able to make a ham and salami grinder. Or so I thought. Upon walking inside the place looks and feels like one might expect. A nice lady in the front took my take out order and a few minutes later the sandwich was ready and out I went. When I got back in my car and opened the box it all went down hill or off a cliff I should say. First I noticed the tomatoes that I did not order followed by banana peppers that were not part of the order and lack of pickles that I did order.
