Next came the bread, fluffy and bone dry exept a few spots that where soaked by balsamic vinegar once again not part of the order. Lastly there was practically no meat on this sandwich. I saw a single slice of ham and a single slice of salami on the half of sandwich that was in my hand. So I went back and said that this was a badly made sandwich and the nice lady gave me a refund and that is my reasoning for a two star review. Unfortunately the pictures of the sandwich came out much better than the product itself.

The place has been around for 95 years. They are doing it right. The meatball and French fries just work together so well. The braciole is tender and the egg noodles with the red "gravy" is just right. The staff just add to this old school charm.

Stopped by for dinner with the family, first night in Providence, couldn't have picked a better place. Food was amazing (even restaurant week specials available!). The staff was great, Jane was especially helpful and friendly, we felt like family right away, would highly recommend!
Reasonable price with old fashioned American Italian food in providence.  You must try.

name: Parkside Rotisserie & Bar
address: 76 S Main St, Providence, RI 02903, USA
reviews: Parkside has been open and offering pickup and delivery since the beginning of Rhode Island’s stay-at-home orders. They have done a fantastic job of transitioning their service to this new landscape. Everything they have done - from an optimized menu to contactless payment to curbside pickup - has been well thought out and deeply appreciated. The food remains not only excellent, but a true treat in this weird landscape we are in. Thank you, Parkside.

If you are looking for a great atmosphere,  absolutely stunningly presented and delicious food , amazing bar and wine selection and great service then you need to visit this great restaurant.  Valet parking.  Thank you for a great evening.

Delicious food,  gracious bartenders,  delicious wine... fun,  casual but somewhat upscale/ nice atmosphere & decor.  Great prices... what more would you want? Great place to enjoy yourself alone and with others. Some unique menu options that are delicious.

Provably the most underrated restaurant in Providence. The food is outstanding and creative. 90% of the time, I get the rotisserie special and I am never disappointed. Last time I actually had the seafood special that included a 6 oz piece of swordfish, Alaskan crab leg, 2 oyster Rockefeller and 2 grilled baby octopus. After dinner, I wanted to try another special that they had, homemade duck sausage, so the kitchen put together a duck sausage appetizer for me to try. No parking, but there's valet parking available.
Bouillabaisse was amazing! This view is epic it's right on the water. Drinks were great, service was perfect, if I'm in Rhode island I'll make sure that I always stop in for the bouillabaisse

name: Olneyville New York System Restaurant
reviews:
This longtime icon has earned the badge of an official Rhode Island  food. From a Greek immigrant's concoction of the finely ground beef from his own ethnic standbys and the unique pork and beef dogs with onion and celery salt in a steamed bun, a legend was born. The association with New York was by name only, because at the time what was more worldly than that city? You'll be as lucky to find a New York System wiener in that city as an English Muffin in London. Don't be fooled by the name, the wieners are a Rhode Island creation as unique as Del's Lemonade, coffee milk and coffee cabinets. 
     In my mind, since childhood, nothing is a better accompaniment than coffee milk. Don't tell your friends you've been to Rhode Island unless you've experienced Olneyville wieners 'all the way' they are the original and the best!
Really friendly staff, helpful and funny. Food is delicious and inexpensive. Get the hot weiners all the way!
Always worth the ride for my system special with coffee milk!!

Serving up great basic food since 1946 is this local landmark. Inside is charmingly dated as a time capsule. Staff is very friendly. I was slightly intimidated going there as a Newbie and not knowing all the vernacular, but the place is great. Hot wieners "all the way" hit the spot and the fries were great. A must stop if in town.
Nothing is better than  Hot Weiners!! Simply Delicious! Olneyville has the best in RHODE ISLAND

name: Bayberry Beer Hall
address: 381 W Fountain St, Providence, RI 02903, USA
reviews: Bayberry is a large, open beer hall with an amazing beer selection and a refined ambiance. They typically have 14 beers on tap and many more in bottles. The space is very clean and the decorations are subtle but very nice. The best and biggest surprise is the food, though. Some of the dishes, particularly the spicy chicken sandwich, are as good as you can find anywhere in Providence. It’s not cheap, but the quality is so high that it doesn’t matter. Check this place out!

Our first stop on a visit from out of town and it didn’t disappoint for one second! Amazing beer list for me and cocktails for my lady. We got the Portuguese sweet bread, chicken biscuit, & huevos rancheros add roasted pork. The house hot sauce was a great touch. Can’t wait to make it back!

Great beer hall in downtown Providence. It's near federal hill, in a wide open space and has great service. Beers are great and I highly recommend the food here, particularly the spicy chicken sandwich. Desert items like the smores shown are also terrific. I will say that the only detractor to this is that it's a tad pricey, but would definitely visit again.

Awesome experience at Bayberry. We liked the communal tables. Very Beer Hall oriented. Easy to understand their ordering system. 
Extensive beer selection. My personal favorite is the Notch. 
I was very impressed with the food. We started with the sourdough pretzels and mustard. Soft, salty and hot! 
We split a burger and Hot Chicken sandwich. Absolutely delicious!

Open atmosphere and everyone seemed friendly. Not too difficult to find parking. Food was really good and the specials were good too! A lot of beer and drink options. We went for brunch and absolutely would come back

name: Opa Restaurant
reviews:
Opa restaurant in Providence RI serves excellent middle eastern food. After a few weeks of eating pescatarian meals, my colleague and I headed to Opa. After a long walk as is our wont, we were seated inside the restaurant. The waiter and his trainee introduced themselves and took our orders. 

Even though it was past 7 pm on Monday, there were hardly any patrons in the restaurant. We were given some traditional shrak/pita bread with olive oil dip. The combination of the bread and oil was good. When our food finally came, we were ready to dig in. I had ordered lamb skewers and there were at least 5 skewers with 3 pieces of meat.  My colleague had ordered the mixed grill and he was enjoying it, being a fast eater. 

Opa restaurant waiter assured me before ordering that the meat is halal and taking his word I started eating. The food is good though some pieces had sinews forcing me to leave the masticated remains underneath the plate. The price is very high at $25+ but I think it is ok for the quantity though I would like to see the quality too.
Excellent service and the DJ was amazing! Awesome atmosphere, ambiance, and the food was delicious! Hookahs were clean and burned forever. Definitely going back and referring friends?

The food is great. Service quick and on point. The quality of Their chicken kabob and beef kabob is exquisite. Tender, juicy and melts in your mouth. Hookah is decent, could improve on the quality but overall is definitely worth a visit.

Amazing lebanese food. Joyce was awesome. She knew everything and was super helpful about suggestions about ordering. Definitely recommend trying the mixed grilled platter so you can get a bit of everything. And ask for the garlic sauce.

Where oh where to begin... this place is amazing! Absolutely a must try for a very filling dinner. The restaurant opens to the outside with seating outside as well. The inside is dimly lit; however, it is a nice ambiance. The menu is extensive with options for everyone. The grilled calamari was the first for us, as typically it's fried; however, we liked having the healthier option. I ordered the 16 oz ribeye, cooked perfectly to medium. It was juicy, tender, and had such great flavor. The salad, was delicious.. for being a salad.. it was crisp and fresh. I chose to substitute the fries for zucchini and mushrooms, which I wasn't hassled for doing so. The meal was absolutely delicious. My other half ordered kabobs, which had a mix of meats, which he enjoyed as well. We were both satisfied with our dinner. Our server was friendly and all of the staff was attentive with quick service. A belly dancer came out as entertaining  which was neat. Wish I had better photos, although the lighting wasn't in my favor.

name: Den Den Café Asiana
reviews: My favorite place to eat in Providence. It's quite the drive but completely worth it in my opinion. It's trendy and has amazing Korean and Japanese dishes. I have had their Tonkatsu (fried pork cutlet), eel rice bowl, and twister potatoes. I would have them all again! Give it a shot!

Please anyone who is looking for an amazing menu with as amazing staff please visit Den Den you will not be disappointed. Spicy Squid and pork belly BBQ In the top picture and located In the picture below is Premium BBQ short rib. Im drooling thinking about it.

Outstanding! This is one of the only restaurants that I can play "menu roulette" and never go wrong. It's not cheap, but it's worth it. This one, the one off Benefit has a nice casual cafe appeal to it whereas the other one near Thayer is much louder and cafeteria like.

Stopped by on a Sunday night before leaving Providence. Food was delicious, tea was great, prices were reasonable and the staff was all friendly. Definitely recommend giving them a shot.

Note: if you don't like fish flakes ask for none on your dish.

Great service. Pay upfront then your order is served to your table.

Clean large relaxing place to eat at. 

Will come back again.

name: Kleos
reviews:
Try Dip Dish appetizers for 6 different spreads & Mediterranean Mule! Main dishes are all good so you won’t make any mistakes when you visit here.
It’s a cozy environment with welcoming wooden tables. Recommend for a nice night out with a partner or friends!

Menu looked so tempting. It was a difficult choice but settled on the gyro, which was delicious served with a small.crispy tomato and feta salad and salted fries. Server Valerie was professional and friendly. When we couldn't decide on a full sized dessert, she brought us tasty cookies gratis. Prices reasonable.  Lovely atmosphere with white lights all around. Highly recommend!

Scallops were cooked perfectly. The pasta with butter and cheese was a hit with kiddo. The spanikopita was... just okay. Something about it, some flavor was unusual and made the whole experience a little off. Overall beautiful environment.

Starting with the good.  Kleos has a great location in the heart of Providence.  Parking can be hard but valet is offered as well. 

Inside you will find a rather tight seating arrangement with small bar.  Outdoor tables are available.  Our waiter was a pleasure and very accommodating and made a suggestion to try the sample plate which was outstanding. 

Sticking with my norm I ordered the rather expensive Gyros Plate that was to be served with fries and a salad.  

What arrived was a typical presentation for this type of meal.  However, I found the salad to be lack luster.  The big pieces of feta cheese on the top was interesting but didn't really offer much to help.  The biggest issue was the Gyro itself in that it was extremely dry and salty. This really needed the help of the tzatziki but surprisingly there was little to be found, a few cuts of tomatoes and onions just about rescued this.  I found the fries to be overcooked as well. 

I may give this place another try as the other reviews suggest it may have just have been an off night.  At the least for my meal.

We just walked in to this restaurant because it looked bright and had a very contemporary look to it. The menu is simple and yet checks all boxes. The food was delicious... we all had the pita sandwiches and they tasted great. The house salad with he house dressing is ahhhhmazing!

name: Bravo Bistro
reviews: I found a spot I'd love to frequent! The ambiance of the bistro was what won me over. The lighting, the warm greeting from our hostess/server. Everything was amazing. I ordered the Bravo Burger and it came with fries and whatever fixings you wanted. The burger was grilled to absolute perfection and the fries were crispy and seasoned deliciously. Simple yet extravagant. My friend ordered the Bravo Steak Sandwich and thoroughly enjoyed it with some A1 and the fries that came with it. I believe our servers name was Olivia and she was absolutely amazing and made my dining experience truly amazing. I'll definitely be coming back.

Gets three stars just for the soup which was good. But stay away from the Crouqe monsieur. Everything that could be bad with it was. Wrong type of bread used, got all soggy, was like eating bread pudding with ham and cheese in it. The bechamel sauce wasn't even put under the broiler to crisp up. Would not recommend this sandwich.other than that place was nice and French onion soup was good.

We tried this restaurant for the first time on Thanksgiving. It was pretty good. They had a traditional turkey & stuffing Thanksgiving plate along with other choices if you wanted something different. The service was good and the atmosphere nice. We would like to try this restaurant again when it's not a holiday.

Murder Mystery plus dinner... Cast is extremely talented and funny!  Audience participation brings family and friends to their knees with laughter.  Food was excellent.  Great night out.  You won't be disappointed.
Relaxing atmosphere and great for a quick bite and drink when you find yourself in downtown Providence. I can't recommend it highly enough.

name: Red Stripe
reviews: We had a wonderful experience at Red Stripe! Food was delicious, service was prompt. Our waitress was very attentive as we had a 5 and 3-year-old with us. Extra silverware and plates, while also taking away clutter from the table. I would highly recommend this place, especially on Wednesdays where it's $1 child meals and $5 martinis!

This restaurant came highly recommended by a friend so I had to check it out. I just landed, I was hungry and I still had to drive to the Cape but I definitely needed fuel for my body so Red Stripe it was. I liked that it was a casual dining spot because I was in “travel clothes” but the food was way above casual. They had a great selection of  meal options. I had their New England Clam Chowder which wasn’t the typical white cream base BUT OMG delicious. I highly recommend it. For my main dish I had the seared sea scallops with risotto. Scallops were perfectly cooked and so was the risotto. I enjoyed my meal immensely and I look forward to visiting this Red Stripe on my next trip up North! I must point out as well great service from the hostess to my server! My only downside was parking, there wasn’t a designated parking lot but I heard this is an issue in Providence not just this restaurant.
Great food and great service. I had the watermelon and feta salad, my boyfriend had the lobster roll. Both were great. I plan on coming back next time I am in the area.

Placed a reservation through Open Table for 8:00pm Christmas Eve. Arrived inside the restaurant at 8:03pm and was told by the host that the restaurant was closed; yet it was still busy. Two women ahead of me were getting sat at a table, just as I was told by the host she would have to ask the manager if my party could still dine. Then the host decided it’s alright to take my party seeing as she had just canceled my reservation. My boyfriend and I get sat against a dirty wall against a corner. After getting quickly greeted by Eric, my party decided what to eat quickly seeing as they were already closed. After telling my server we were ready to order, he doesn’t reappear for 10 minutes. Eric proceeds to write down our order, then explains they have run out of truffle fries. This doesn’t make sense seeing as other menu items have Parmesan or truffle so not sure what they ran out of; he then leaves for some time and finally gets my boyfriends drink. Our food didn’t take long to arrive. The fries are great, buffalo cauliflower could’ve been cooked a little longer but still good, burger was good, except Eric forgot my boyfriends bacon so he had to wait to eat it until it was grabbed. Enjoyed what we could, then tried for some time to get Eric’s attention. Took some time to get the bill, which arrived with another tables’ check, we paid and quickly left. Had some high hopes for this place after reading some of the other reviews, so left disappointed. Would’ve stayed and ordered more if the service wasn’t so poor overall. We didn’t expect fast service for Christmas Eve, but a little more attention to detail wouldn’t hurt.

Had lunch with friends. It's been a year since I've dined here. Reuben and fries.. fries were really greasy and beef rather thick and chewy.  Our waitress was inattentive. I had to ask for water twice. I drink a lot of water, thank you. She did ask "how is everything ". But that was when we were almost done. She was pleasant but needs to spend more time watching her table than chatting with employees. Come on, there were only 5 full tables in the entire restaurant.

name: Hemenway's Restaurant
address: 121 S Main St, Providence, RI 02903, USA
reviews: I’ve been here a few times and it’s definitely becoming a favorite. Nancy, our waitress, made us feel at home and well taken care of. She recommended a great wine that truly complimented our dinner and was very personable and professional which helped to amount to a great night out. She is definitely an  asset to the wait staff. The food was great, again. I highly recommend the chefs special,  Grilled Swordfish, and you have to have the oysters, they might be the best part. 10/10

This restaurant is nestled in the Brown University campus building. Lots of window you can look out to the beautiful city building around and park walk ways. The seafood is fresh. As it was restaurant week when I visited I had the 3 course price fix and added a beet salad. Each dish was good. Mushroom soup to start was delicious. Second was the beet salad, great, this was my add on because it reminds me of Sunday lunch my Mom use to make so any chance I get for beet salad I take it :0). Third was baked stuffed lobster 1.25lbs. this was a bit salty due to the seasoning salts, I might be over rating as I am not a salt guy. And finally desert was topped off with carrot cake and banana ice cream. Not a big carrot cake fan so the ice cream is what I had and it was Yummy.

Really nice place. Lump crab appetizer was top notch. Escargot was good (but I thought the bread crumbs were a little overwhelming). Excellent paella and excellent scallops! Service was a little slow at the start (it was a busy Saturday night) but otherwise great.

Food was delicious the waitress Gabriela was not up to par.. Asked her for something and watched as she spoke to another employee half way done with entree an finally received the lemon i asked for. She did not offer bread we had to ask  After being seated for 5 minutes.  Hats off to the chef today for sure food was great

This was my first time and a restaurant of this caliber and I definitely was not disappointed. The staff was amazing and when I told the waitress that this was my first time having a raw oyster, she promised to choose a good one and definitely seem to deliver. We had a large party who ordered a large variety of dishes and not a single person was disappointed. If you were looking for a little more upscale restaurant very close to historic buildings I highly recommend this restaurant. You won't be disappointed.

name: Milk Money
address: 566 S Water St, Providence, RI 02903, USA
reviews: First time at Milk Money but definitely not the last. Charming decor, quick friendly service and amazing meal! Serves tapas style, enjoy all the variety they have to offer. Every dish that came out was presented beautifully and prepared perfectly. From the deviled eggs and octopus to the chard and potatoes. DO NOT miss the fried chicken! AMAZING!!! Great desert selection , the lemon semi-freddo with the berries was out of this world! You leave satisfied but not overwhelmingly stuffed! My only caveat is the bone marrow... not worth the $...very little marrow, pass on that!

Overall great experience!  We were celebrating my son's bday and tried so many delectable goods.  It's tapas style, so order many things and share.  Our waitress was awesome and helped with the selection process.  Great for foodies ❤️♥️❤️♥️.  I will definitely return.

Definitely worth trying for Sunday brunch where the vibe is casual and hip, and the food is good. Parking available in the back and on S. Water Street. The management was friendly, greeting each party at the door before being seated. Enjoyed the focus on locally-sourced foods and ingredients. Will definitely go back to try the dinner which I understand offers lots of tapas plates for sharing or trying new foods. Fun place.

Came here for brunch following a bachelor party. Everyone absolutely loved their meal. I got the French toast and it was perfect. The side of bacon is also super Thick. Almost like bacon-steak. Worth a try.

Would come back! Close to the highway, friendly staff, great atmosphere for chilling and chit-chatting. Food service was a little slow, but the food makes up for it! Delicious and flavorful! Great cocktails, alcoholic as well as non-alcoholic. Coffee was great too, perfect brunch location! Extra points for bamboo straws instead of plastic.

name: Ten Prime Steak & Sushi
reviews: Food and service were fantastic. The restaurant was very clean and uncluttered. My date and i ordered oysters and a sushi roll for an app, the ny cut steak and the rib eye steak for the main course; then banana bread pudding for dessert. Everything came out in a good amount of time and our waiter was very attentive and helpful when we were deciding our meal. Will definitely be going back. Oh the banana bread pudding was delicious and the "smoke show" cocktail was great as well!

I’ve only been to Ten Prime twice in the last 6 years, both times for a birthday dinner. This time, it was my birthday, and also restaurant week. Just like my first visit, the food and experience were exceptional. I absolutely enjoyed my food and would go back!

I come to Providence once a year. I have 2 nights to go out to eat.  I can’t help but keep going back to 10 Prime for the amazing sushi rolls, good ambiance, and great service. The executive chef is awesome here too. I like to sit at the bar. Ryan’s cocktails behind the bar are next level.

Originally I had left my review blank.
That's essentially my impression of 10 Prime Steak & Sushi. It's nothing to write home about, in almost any way. It was remarkable when it opened, 20 years ago. It was modern then - even futuristic. It hasn't kept up that pace in menu innovation (even the beer & wine list remain stagnant) nor the decor (I post a picture here of a once fantastic saltwater tank for reference . The person responsible for maintaining it should not have that job). The same regulars at the bar, getting all of the staff's attention, just 20 years older. Nothing wrong with consistency, except it can grow old and tired. My recent visit could not have been more lackluster.

Outstanding! I almost forgot how good some of the restaurants down city are. Ten was great. Some of the art in the place made the experience uncomfortable. But the food made up for it. A must if you admire a succulent steak on occasion.

name: Broadway Bistro
reviews: Small intimate atmosphere.  Food is magnificent and well plated.  Wait staff was attentive and more than helpful when I spilled my port!  Can't go wrong with a stop wether dining or at the bar.
Excellent little restaurant within walking distance of Columbus Theater & shops. Excellent friendly service. Menu is not extensive but the food was very good!
Fun and unique menu selection with a good variety of vegetarian dishes.
One of our favorite restaurants ever!  Imaginative menu, cooked to perfection.  Good helpful staff.  Place has never failed to delight us!
Great bread. Best vegetable Ramen I've ever had. Fast service. Good music. Would return.

name: New Rivers
reviews:
It's a nice cozy and friendly place in a grubby city, Providence.  We ordered the night's special braised beef with a light cream corn and shiitake mushrooms.  Excellent! The corn was not heavy at all, very light, ultra light.  The beef was cooked well, although I did find it a bit grossly but more than acceptable.  This was a well prepared plate. 
 Judging by the crowd it is a local, after work, professional neighborhood place.
Staff and wait service was friendly and very amicable.
Would go again.
One downer...no online reservations.  You have to call...call...to make a reservation .  LOL.

Amazing experience everytime I've been here! The menu is so diverse and offers spectacular dishes. The amount of flavor packed in each meal I've had is incredible. Highly recommend trying one (or all) of their desserts! Their chocolate sorbet has to be my favorite. Thank you New Rivers for bringing Providence delicious eats!

Fresh ingredients and creative dishes with amazing flavors. We made reservations for an early dinner and the restaurant was quiet and intimate while still being casual. Service was quick and attentive and happy to accommodate any special requests or to make suggestions on the menu. The dishes are on the smaller size but still satisfying and the flavor provides are excellent. Plenty of fresh ingredients and specialty flavors that blend together and make a great bite. We left around normal dinner time and things were getting busy so reservations are a must. A great place for a date night in the city.
Great food with always something unique. Cozy space. Wonderful wait staff.
The food is excellent. The menu offers surprising combinations of flavors and many options both for vegetarians and meat lovers.

name: Mare Rooftop
reviews: The name says summer but it’s a great place in winter too. This sleek and elegant place is full of twinkly lights and yummy Italian seafood.  During winter it’s frenetic vibe is quiet and chill. I’ll be back to the huge and comfortable bar for great pizza and fresh seafood.

Mare Rooftop is amazing. The staff is super attentive and the food is outstanding. The environment is romantic and I cannot wait to visit again in the summer. The owner, Rob, is a very nice gentleman and runs a wonderful restaurant. This gem on the East Side of Providence is the perfect spot for date night. On our visit, we had Nate as our waiter. He was attentive and very pleasant to interact with. You have to try this restaurant as it is one of the best in Rhode Island. Thank you, Mare Rooftop for a special Valentines meal. We cannot wait to return.

Clean aesthetic not gaudy. The food IS good, not pretending to be. Each bite surprised me with exactly how flavorful it was. The people were absolutely friendly and down to earth. Valet was modern with a link sent to your phone to recall your car. Beyond expectation in all directions and still priced within reason. I honestly, almost didn't want to like it, but I did 🙂

This place has been on my radar for sometime, but mixed reviews kept me from making a reservation... until last night. It was beautiful weather and my BF wanted to dine at a rooftop restaurant. So, I took a chance and made made a reservation. BOY am I glad I did!! Let me tell you, nearly everything about this place was phenomenal. First, free street parking (although they have a valet). We were greeted in the lobby and had our reservation validated before directed to the elevators. Upon exiting, we were greeted by name and although I had requested a table by the windows, they offered us a table outdoors if preferred. They let us check it out before we decided to go with an outdoor table. (If it had been hotter, we would go inside since they open up the wall of windows but you have shade) Our server, Stephanie was en pointe. Her timing was perfect, attentive but not rushing. Drinks: Red sangria & G&T were spot on for a summer Eve. BF had oysters &  shared the grain salad - glad we did, it's big enough for a light entree. Followed up with paella for 2. We couldn't stop raving about the dishes, not something I've been doing lately. The salad was the perfect combo of texture and flavors and dressed to perfection. The paella was equally good. Both are chock full of tasty nugget surprises. Not sure what's up with other reviews, but I will definitely be back!

The co reviewer and I decided to try this much talked about rooftop establishment as part of restaurant week Providence.

The interior is clean, comfortable and the vibe is hip.  Olivia our server did a great job making sure our meals were perfect and checking in on us all night!

We both had the three course dinner special.   The tomato soup was excellent and hit the spot on such a raw night.

I had the filet mignon and the co reviewer had the chicken scallopine.  Both were excellent.

The Vanilla flan was a perfect dessert for the evening. 

We have to come back and try the brunch very soon!

name: figidini
reviews:
Absolutely amazing pizza. The dough is out of this world. The service is great and the owner who makes the pizza is always up for a chat and sharing his journey of pizza making.

Overall, this is one of the best if not THE best pie you will have in New England.

I come to this superb restaurant from time to time because I enjoy the good mood that is part of this restaurant. The crew is highly welcoming and skilfull. The service is absolutely quick. Most important, the food you eat is magnificent. I ate there many times and I was always satisfied. The price is honest. I highly suggest this place to my friends and family.
best actual Neapolitan pizza (only pizza worth eating) I have had in the USA so far. Great homemade soda and fantastic service.

The atmosphere is cool but that doesn’t make up for the soggy, bland pizza. So many better places to go in RI for pizza. We were disappointed. Literally Had to eat the pizza with a spoon it was so wet.
AMAZING pizza! Everything else is amazing (drinks are inspired) too but the Margarita Extra pizza will haunt you.
